exampleEn: The university held an open day for prospective students and parents.
exampleZh: 大學為未來的學生及其家長舉辦了開放日。

exampleEn: Can we swap seats so I can sit next to the window?
exampleZh: 我們可以換座位嗎？這樣我可以坐在窗邊。

exampleEn: He works remotely from his home office and rarely goes in.
exampleZh: 他在家庭辦公室遠程工作，很少去辦公室。

exampleEn: The field was covered in beautiful purple violet flowers in spring.
exampleZh: 春天，田野裡開滿了美麗的紫色紫羅蘭花。

exampleEn: She has a bubbly personality and is always smiling and laughing.
exampleZh: 她性格開朗，總是面帶微笑和歡笑。

exampleEn: The traffic moved chaotically through the busy intersection without signals.
exampleZh: 交通在沒有信號燈的繁忙路口混亂地移動。

exampleEn: She's apprehensive about flying.
exampleZh: 她對飛行感到擔憂。

exampleEn: We sat on the comfortable settee in the living room together.
exampleZh: 我們一起坐在客廳舒適的長椅上。

exampleEn: The children jumped up and down on the trampoline in the garden.
exampleZh: 孩子們在花園裡的蹦床上跳上跳下。

exampleEn: You need a lot of stamina to run a full marathon.
exampleZh: 跑完全程馬拉松需要很大的耐力。

exampleEn: It was just a ploy to get more money from us.
exampleZh: 這只是一個從我們這裡得到更多錢的策略。

exampleEn: Don't dither; make a decision quickly so we can leave.
exampleZh: 別猶豫了；快做決定，這樣我們就可以離開了。

exampleEn: The mechanic wore greasy overalls while repairing the broken car engine.
exampleZh: 機械師修理壞掉的汽車引擎時穿著油膩的工作服。

exampleEn: The choir sang in perfect unison, creating a beautiful harmony sound.
exampleZh: 合唱團齊聲歌唱，創造出美妙的和聲。

exampleEn: The snail moved slowly across the garden path, leaving a trail.
exampleZh: 蝸牛在花園小徑上緩慢移動，留下一條痕跡。

exampleEn: They lived in wedded bliss.
exampleZh: 他們過著幸福的婚姻生活。

exampleEn: He seems to have an inexhaustible supply of energy and enthusiasm.
exampleZh: 他似乎有取之不盡的精力和熱情。

exampleEn: They own 50 acres of land.
exampleZh: 他們擁有五十英畝土地。

exampleEn: The farmer keeps a young heifer in the field for breeding.
exampleZh: 農夫在田里養了一頭年輕的小母牛用於繁殖。

exampleEn: The ewe watched over her lambs protectively in the grassy meadow.
exampleZh: 母羊在草地上保護性地看守著她的羔羊。

exampleEn: He defeated his adversary.
exampleZh: 他擊敗了對手。

exampleEn: The victorious team celebrated their win with a parade through town.
exampleZh: 獲勝的隊伍在鎮上舉行遊行慶祝勝利。

exampleEn: He raised his arms victoriously after crossing the finish line first.
exampleZh: 第一個衝過終點線後，他勝利地舉起了雙臂。

exampleEn: The book had a profound impact on my way of thinking.
exampleZh: 這本書對我的思維方式產生了深遠的影響。

exampleEn: She was profoundly affected by the tragic news of her friend.
exampleZh: 她深受朋友悲慘消息的影響。

exampleEn: He stated baldly that he would not support the new proposal.
exampleZh: 他直截了當地說他不會支持這項新提議。

exampleEn: The bearded man looked like a wise old wizard from stories.
exampleZh: 留著鬍子的男人看起來像故事裡的智慧老巫師。

exampleEn: She handled the difficult client with great professionalism and patience.
exampleZh: 她以極大的專業精神和耐心處理了這位難纏的客戶。

exampleEn: The cake was artistically decorated with colorful flowers made of sugar.
exampleZh: 蛋糕上裝飾著用糖做的五顏六色的花，富有藝術感。

exampleEn: The popularization of the internet has changed how we communicate daily.
exampleZh: 互聯網的普及改變了我們日常交流的方式。

exampleEn: The pendulum of the grandfather clock swung back and forth rhythmically.
exampleZh: 老爺鐘的鐘擺有節奏地來回擺動。

exampleEn: The new manager is much stricter than his predecessor was before.
exampleZh: 新經理比他的前任嚴格得多。

exampleEn: He had a momentary lapse in concentration and crashed the car.
exampleZh: 他一時注意力不集中，撞毀了車。

exampleEn: The noise was ceaseless.
exampleZh: 噪音不停。

exampleEn: The waves crashed ceaselessly against the rocks on the shore.
exampleZh: 海浪不停地拍打著岸邊的岩石。

exampleEn: The story reached its climax.
exampleZh: 故事達到高潮。

exampleEn: The movie ended with a climactic battle between good and evil.
exampleZh: 電影以善惡之間的決戰結束。

exampleEn: The ending of the book was anticlimactic and disappointing to readers.
exampleZh: 這本書的結局虎頭蛇尾，讓讀者失望。

exampleEn: If you don't show up, you will forfeit your deposit money.
exampleZh: 如果你不出現，你將沒收你的訂金。

exampleEn: His eye began to twitch nervously when he was lying.
exampleZh: 撒謊時他的眼睛開始緊張地抽搐。

exampleEn: She is a woman of great intellect and sharp wit.
exampleZh: 她是一個才智過人、思維敏捷的女人。

exampleEn: The plane began its descent into the airport for landing.
exampleZh: 飛機開始下降進入機場降落。

exampleEn: There was a mass exodus of people from the war-torn city.
exampleZh: 人們大規模逃離戰亂城市。

exampleEn: The statue was built to immortalize the hero who saved many.
exampleZh: 這座雕像是為了紀念拯救許多人的英雄而建的。

exampleEn: Scientists are mapping the human genome to understand genetic diseases.
exampleZh: 科學家正在繪製人類基因組圖譜以了解遺傳疾病。

exampleEn: Only a small fraction of applicants were accepted into the competitive program.
exampleZh: 只有一小部分申請者被這個競爭激烈的課程錄取。

exampleEn: A faction within the party disagreed with the leader's new policy.
exampleZh: 黨內的一個派系不同意領導人的新政策。

exampleEn: He has the physique of a professional athlete, strong and muscular.
exampleZh: 他擁有職業運動員的體格，強壯且肌肉發達。

exampleEn: The kitchen drawer is full of cooking utensils like spoons and forks.
exampleZh: 廚房抽屜裡裝滿了烹飪用具，如勺子和叉子。

exampleEn: The playful otter swam in the river and caught a fish.
exampleZh: 頑皮的水獺在河裡游泳並抓到了一條魚。

exampleEn: His hands were cold and clammy with sweat from nervousness.
exampleZh: 因為緊張，他的手又冷又濕，全是汗。

exampleEn: The machine can dispense coffee, tea, and hot chocolate drinks.
exampleZh: 這台機器可以分配咖啡、茶和熱巧克力飲料。

exampleEn: The patient went to the dispensary to pick up his medicine.
exampleZh: 病人去藥房取藥。

exampleEn: The two roads diverge in the woods; we took the left.
exampleZh: 兩條路在樹林裡分岔；我們走了左邊那條。

exampleEn: There is a divergence of opinion on how to solve this.
exampleZh: 關於如何解決這個問題存在分歧。

exampleEn: They have divergent views on politics, but they are still friends.
exampleZh: 他們在政治上有不同的看法，但他們仍然是朋友。

exampleEn: He only has a superficial knowledge of the subject, not deep.
exampleZh: 他對這個學科只有膚淺的了解，並不深入。

exampleEn: The wound was only superficially treated, so it got infected later.
exampleZh: 傷口只作了表面處理，所以後來感染了。

exampleEn: The design has aesthetic appeal.
exampleZh: 設計具有美學吸引力。

exampleEn: The building is aesthetically pleasing with its modern design and glass.
exampleZh: 這座建築的現代設計和玻璃在美學上令人愉悅。

exampleEn: The auditor will scrutinize the company's financial records very carefully.
exampleZh: 審計員將非常仔細地審查公司的財務記錄。

exampleEn: The politician's actions came under close scrutiny by the media.
exampleZh: 這位政治家的行為受到了媒體的密切關注。

exampleEn: He made a funny quip that lightened the mood in room.
exampleZh: 他說了一句俏皮話，緩和了房間裡的氣氛。

exampleEn: The company tried to woo new customers with special discounts.
exampleZh: 公司試圖用特別折扣來吸引新客戶。

exampleEn: What are the criteria for selecting the winner of the competition?
exampleZh: 選拔比賽獲勝者的標準是什麼？

exampleEn: His excuse for being late sounded plausible, so I believed him.
exampleZh: 他遲到的藉口聽起來很合理，所以我相信了他。

exampleEn: The plausibility of his story was questioned by the police.
exampleZh: 警方質疑他故事的合理性。

exampleEn: She argued plausibly that the mistake was not her fault.
exampleZh: 她似乎有理地爭辯說這個錯誤不是她的錯。

exampleEn: It was an instinctive reaction to jump back when the car appeared.
exampleZh: 當車出現時向後跳是一種本能反應。

exampleEn: She instinctively knew that something was wrong when she entered.
exampleZh: 當她進去時，她本能地知道有些不對勁。

exampleEn: The author made some stylistic changes to improve the flow of text.
exampleZh: 作者做了一些風格上的修改以改善文本的流暢性。

exampleEn: Stylistically, the painting resembles the work of Picasso in many ways.
exampleZh: 在風格上，這幅畫在許多方面類似於畢卡索的作品。

exampleEn: He received a large inheritance from his grandfather who passed away.
exampleZh: 他從去世的祖父那裡繼承了一大筆遺產。

exampleEn: There are inherent risks involved in skydiving that you must accept.
exampleZh: 跳傘有內在的風險，你必須接受。

exampleEn: Fire is inherently dangerous and must be handled with extreme care.
exampleZh: 火本質上是危險的，必須極其小心地處理。

exampleEn: The crowd burst into spontaneous applause after the brilliant performance.
exampleZh: 精彩的表演結束後，人群自發地爆發出掌聲。

exampleEn: We decided spontaneously to go on a road trip without planning.
exampleZh: 我們自發地決定去公路旅行，沒有計畫。

exampleEn: The driver honked his horn at the car blocking the road.
exampleZh: 司機向擋路的車鳴喇叭。

exampleEn: Wild geese migrate thousands of miles each year in their distinctive V-formation.
exampleZh: 野鵝每年以其獨特的V字形遷徙數千英里。

exampleEn: Companies must innovate to stay ahead of the competition in market.
exampleZh: 公司必須創新才能在市場競爭中保持領先。

exampleEn: He is a connoisseur of fine wines and has a large collection.
exampleZh: 他是美酒的鑑賞家，有大量的收藏。

exampleEn: The concept of 'justice' is an abstraction that is hard to define.
exampleZh: “正義”的概念是一個難以定義的抽象概念。

exampleEn: The toddler threw a tantrum in the store because he wanted candy.
exampleZh: 蹣跚學步的孩子在商店裡發脾氣，因為他想要糖果。

exampleEn: Please discard your trash in the bin provided near the exit.
exampleZh: 請將垃圾丟在出口附近的垃圾桶裡。

exampleEn: There was one fatality in the car accident on the highway.
exampleZh: 高速公路上的車禍造成一人死亡。

exampleEn: His body stiffened with fear when he saw the bear approaching.
exampleZh: 當他看到熊靠近時，他的身體因恐懼而僵硬。

exampleEn: They went for a walk in the wooded area behind the house.
exampleZh: 他們去房子後面的樹木繁茂的地區散步。

exampleEn: His compliments seemed insincere, as if he was just trying to flatter me.
exampleZh: 他的讚美似乎不真誠，好像只是想奉承我。

exampleEn: He tried to win her favor with compliments and flattery.
exampleZh: 他試圖用讚美和奉承來贏得她的好感。

exampleEn: He felt aimless.
exampleZh: 他感到漫無目標。

exampleEn: She wandered aimlessly.
exampleZh: 她漫無目的地遊蕩。

exampleEn: Life without purpose can feel empty and meaningless sometimes.
exampleZh: 沒有目標的生活有時會讓人感到空虛和毫無意義。

exampleEn: He stared meaninglessly at the wall, lost in his own thoughts.
exampleZh: 他茫然地盯著牆，陷入了自己的沉思。

exampleEn: She was very candid about her feelings and hid nothing.
exampleZh: 她對自己的感情很坦率，沒有任何隱瞞。

exampleEn: I spoke candidly to my boss about the problems in the office.
exampleZh: 我坦率地向老闆講述了辦公室的問題。

exampleEn: Her energy and vitality are inspiring to everyone around her.
exampleZh: 她的精力和活力激勵著周圍的每個人。

exampleEn: Don't provoke the dog, or it might bite you aggressively.
exampleZh: 不要激怒狗，否則它可能會猛烈地咬你。

exampleEn: She wore a provocative dress that attracted a lot of attention.
exampleZh: 她穿了一件引人注目的連衣裙，吸引了很多人的注意。

exampleEn: He spoke provocatively, trying to start an argument with the group.
exampleZh: 他挑釁地說話，試圖與這群人爭吵。

exampleEn: He clenched his fists.
exampleZh: 他握緊拳頭。

exampleEn: I had to haggle with the vendor to get a better price.
exampleZh: 我不得不與小販討價還價以獲得更好的價格。

exampleEn: He looked at the cheater with scorn and refused to speak.
exampleZh: 他輕蔑地看著騙子，拒絕說話。

exampleEn: She gave a scornful laugh at his ridiculous suggestion.
exampleZh: 她對他荒謬的建議發出輕蔑的笑聲。

exampleEn: He spoke scornfully of the politicians who broke their promises.
exampleZh: 他輕蔑地談論那些違背諾言的政客。

exampleEn: They talked animatedly about their upcoming holiday plans together.
exampleZh: 他們興致勃勃地談論著即將到來的假期計畫。

exampleEn: The details of the contract were obscure and hard to understand.
exampleZh: 合約的細節晦澀難懂。

exampleEn: The poet wrote obscurely, using metaphors that few could understand.
exampleZh: 詩人寫得很隱晦，使用了很少人能理解的隱喻。

exampleEn: We need to elevate the monitor so it is at eye level.
exampleZh: 我們需要抬高顯示器，使其與視線齊平。

exampleEn: The mountain has an elevation of over 3000 meters above sea level.
exampleZh: 這座山的海拔超過 3000 米。

exampleEn: The lecture went on tediously for two hours without a break.
exampleZh: 講座乏味地進行了兩個小時，沒有休息。

exampleEn: We had a succession of rainy days that ruined our holiday.
exampleZh: 我們接連幾天都在下雨，毀了我們的假期。

exampleEn: The interview was just a formality; he already got the job.
exampleZh: 面試只是一個形式；他已經得到了這份工作。

exampleEn: The mountaineer climbed the highest peak in the range successfully.
exampleZh: 登山者成功登上了山脈的最高峰。

exampleEn: She was a pioneer in women's rights and fought for equality.
exampleZh: 她是女權的先驅，為平等而奮鬥。

exampleEn: The knights went on a quest to find the holy grail.
exampleZh: 騎士們踏上了尋找聖杯的旅程。

exampleEn: They took a transatlantic flight from New York to London.
exampleZh: 他們乘坐從紐約到倫敦的跨大西洋航班。

exampleEn: He learned the rudiments of cooking from his mother at home.
exampleZh: 他在家跟媽媽學了烹飪的基礎知識。

exampleEn: Her knowledge of French is only rudimentary, just a few words.
exampleZh: 她的法語知識很淺薄，只有幾個字。

exampleEn: The Grand Canyon is of immense size and beauty that amazes visitors.
exampleZh: 大峽谷規模巨大且美麗，讓遊客驚嘆不已。

exampleEn: I enjoyed the concert immensely and would go again anytime.
exampleZh: 我非常喜歡這場音樂會，隨時都想再去。

exampleEn: The advisory board met today.
exampleZh: 諮詢委員會今天開會。

exampleEn: It has been a trying time for the family with recent illness.
exampleZh: 由於最近生病，這段時間對這個家庭來說很艱難。

exampleEn: The adrenaline rush helped him run faster than ever before.
exampleZh: 腎上腺素的飆升幫助他跑得比以往任何時候都快。

exampleEn: He likes to tinker with old cars in his garage on weekends.
exampleZh: 週末他喜歡在車庫裡擺弄舊車。

exampleEn: The airplane lavatory is occupied; please wait for the next available one.
exampleZh: 飛機洗手間被佔用；請等待下一個可用的。

exampleEn: Winning the award was the pinnacle of her acting career.
exampleZh: 獲獎是她演藝生涯的頂峰。

exampleEn: She feels insecure about her appearance and always wears makeup.
exampleZh: 她對自己的外表感到不安全，總是化妝。

exampleEn: The shelf was fastened insecurely and fell off the wall.
exampleZh: 架子沒固定好，從牆上掉了下來。

exampleEn: He tried to reassure her that everything would be okay.
exampleZh: 他試圖向她保證一切都會好起來的。

exampleEn: She needed constant reassurance from her parents before the exam.
exampleZh: 考試前她需要父母不斷的安慰。

exampleEn: It was insensitive of him to make jokes about her weight.
exampleZh: 他拿她的體重開玩笑太不敏感了。

exampleEn: He spoke insensitively about the tragedy, upsetting everyone in the room.
exampleZh: 他對這場悲劇麻木不仁，讓房間裡的每個人都很不安。

exampleEn: He continues to profess his innocence despite the evidence against him.
exampleZh: 儘管有證據對他在不利，他繼續聲稱自己是無辜的。

exampleEn: The main drawback of the plan is the high cost involved.
exampleZh: 該計畫的主要缺點是成本高昂。

exampleEn: A manager was hired to oversee the construction of the building.
exampleZh: 聘請了一名經理來監督大樓的建設。

exampleEn: The overseer watched the workers closely to ensure quality work.
exampleZh: 監督員密切注視著工人，以確保工作質量。

exampleEn: In my estimation, the project will take another week to complete.
exampleZh: 據我估計，該項目還需要一週才能完成。

exampleEn: She acts as a liaison between the school and the parents.
exampleZh: 她充當學校與家長之間的聯絡人。

exampleEn: The week passed stressfully as they prepared for the big audit.
exampleZh: 當他們準備進行大審計時，這一週過得很緊張。

exampleEn: Dark clouds began to loom on the horizon, signaling a storm.
exampleZh: 烏雲開始在地平線上隱現，預示著暴風雨。

exampleEn: He was still tired, notwithstanding the long sleep he had.
exampleZh: 儘管睡了很久，他還是很累。

exampleEn: The building is structurally sound and safe to enter now.
exampleZh: 這座建築結構穩固，現在可以安全進入。

exampleEn: The earthquake caused structural damage to the bridge and roads.
exampleZh: 地震對橋樑和道路造成了結構性破壞。

exampleEn: The chauffeur opened the door for the actress as she arrived.
exampleZh: 女演員到達時，司機為她打開了車門。

exampleEn: A sedentary lifestyle can lead to health problems like obesity.
exampleZh: 久坐不動的生活方式會導致肥胖等健康問題。

exampleEn: The teacher has an excellent rapport with her students in class.
exampleZh: 這位老師在課堂上與學生關係融洽。

exampleEn: I had a consultation with my lawyer.
exampleZh: 我與律師進行了諮詢。

exampleEn: He started his own management consultancy after leaving the firm.
exampleZh: 離開公司後，他創辦了自己的管理諮詢公司。

exampleEn: The company focuses on employee retention to keep talent.
exampleZh: 公司專注於員工保留以留住人才。

exampleEn: Limestone is mined from the quarry and used for building.
exampleZh: 石灰石是從採石場開採並用於建築的。

exampleEn: The product must meet the exact specification provided by the client.
exampleZh: 產品必須符合客戶提供的確切規格。

exampleEn: The contractor will start work tomorrow.
exampleZh: 承包商明天開工。

exampleEn: He is the proud possessor of a rare collection of stamps.
exampleZh: 他是稀有郵票收藏的驕傲擁者。

exampleEn: There's a chill in the air.
exampleZh: 空氣中有寒意。

exampleEn: It's chilly this morning.
exampleZh: 今天早上很冷。

exampleEn: It was a frosty morning, and the grass was covered in white.
exampleZh: 這是一個霜凍的早晨，草地上覆蓋著白色的霜。

exampleEn: She stared frostily at him after he insulted her friend.
exampleZh: 他侮辱了她的朋友後，她冷冷地盯著他。

exampleEn: The unmanned drone flew over the area to take surveillance photos.
exampleZh: 無人機飛越該地區拍攝監控照片。

exampleEn: The hotel room felt cold and impersonal, lacking any character.
exampleZh: 飯店房間感覺冷漠，缺乏任何個性。

exampleEn: The letter was written impersonally, addressed to 'Dear Customer'.
exampleZh: 這封信寫得很客套，稱呼是“親愛的顧客”。

exampleEn: It is a crime to impersonate a police officer.
exampleZh: 冒充警察是犯罪行為。

exampleEn: The Elvis impersonator sang and danced just like the real king.
exampleZh: 貓王模仿者唱歌跳舞就像真正的國王一樣。

exampleEn: His impersonation of the president was so good it was funny.
exampleZh: 他模仿總統模仿得太好了，很有趣。

exampleEn: Press the buzzer if you know the answer to the question.
exampleZh: 如果你知道問題的答案，請按蜂鳴器。

exampleEn: The soldier was punished for desertion after leaving his post.
exampleZh: 這名士兵因擅離職守而受到懲罰。

exampleEn: The house has been unoccupied for years and is falling apart.
exampleZh: 這所房子已經空置多年，快要倒塌了。

exampleEn: It is getting stuffy in here; let's open a window.
exampleZh: 這裡變得很悶；我們開窗吧。

exampleEn: He complained stuffily about the poor service in the restaurant.
exampleZh: 他對餐廳糟糕的服務大加抱怨。

exampleEn: The stuffiness of the room made me feel sleepy and tired.
exampleZh: 房間的悶熱讓我感到昏昏欲睡和疲倦。

exampleEn: The tourists gaped at the magnificent palace with wide eyes.
exampleZh: 遊客們睜大眼睛盯著宏偉的宮殿。

exampleEn: He is a man of high repute and is respected by all.
exampleZh: 他是一個享有盛譽的人，受到所有人的尊敬。

exampleEn: The coach admired the mental toughness of the young player.
exampleZh: 教練很欣賞這位年輕球員的心理韌性。

exampleEn: We need to call a plumber to fix the plumbing in bathroom.
exampleZh: 我們需要叫水管工來修浴室的水管。

exampleEn: He looked glum after hearing that the game was cancelled.
exampleZh: 聽到比賽取消的消息，他看起來悶悶不樂。

exampleEn: She sat glumly by the window, watching the rain fall down.
exampleZh: 她悶悶不樂地坐在窗邊，看著雨落下。

exampleEn: He tried gamely to finish the race despite his injured leg.
exampleZh: 儘管腿受傷，他還是勇敢地試圖完成比賽。

exampleEn: In biology class, we had to dissect a frog to study anatomy.
exampleZh: 在生物課上，我們不得不解剖青蛙來研究生理解剖。

exampleEn: The dissection of the poem revealed its deeper meaning and themes.
exampleZh: 對這首詩的剖析揭示了其更深層的含義和主題。

exampleEn: I commend you for your effort.
exampleZh: 我讚揚你的努力。

exampleEn: He received a letter of commendation for his bravery in fire.
exampleZh: 他因在火災中的英勇表現而收到表揚信。

exampleEn: He signed the contract, thereby agreeing to all the terms.
exampleZh: 他簽署了合同，從而同意了所有條款。

exampleEn: She flicked the light switch, but nothing happened because of the power outage.
exampleZh: 她撥動電燈開關，但因為停電什麼也沒發生。

exampleEn: The candle began to flicker in the wind and then went out.
exampleZh: 蠟燭在風中開始閃爍，然後熄滅了。

exampleEn: He has the unenviable task of telling the team they lost.
exampleZh: 告訴球隊他們輸了是一項艱鉅的任務。

exampleEn: He was unenviably placed in the middle of the argument.
exampleZh: 他不幸地處於爭論的中間。

exampleEn: They allege he stole money.
exampleZh: 他們聲稱他偷了錢。

exampleEn: He refused to take a bribe.
exampleZh: 他拒絕收受賄賂。

exampleEn: Bribery is illegal.
exampleZh: 賄賂是違法的。

exampleEn: The inclusion of her name on the list was a mistake.
exampleZh: 把她的名字列入名單是一個錯誤。

exampleEn: The price is inclusive of all taxes and service charges.
exampleZh: 價格包含所有稅費和服務費。

exampleEn: The organization works inclusively to support people from all backgrounds.
exampleZh: 該組織致力於包容性地支持來自各種背景的人。

exampleEn: His explanation was unconvincing, and nobody believed his story.
exampleZh: 他的解釋有些牽強，沒人相信他的故事。

exampleEn: She smiled unconvincingly when asked if she was okay.
exampleZh: 當被問及是否還好時，她勉強地笑了笑。

exampleEn: I need to recharge my phone battery because it is low.
exampleZh: 我需要給手機電池充電，因為它快沒電了。

exampleEn: The facilitation of the meeting helped us reach a decision quickly.
exampleZh: 會議的推動幫助我們迅速做出了決定。

exampleEn: The offer is conditional on passing the medical examination first.
exampleZh: 錄用以首先通過體檢為條件。

exampleEn: He was released conditionally and must report to the police weekly.
exampleZh: 他被有條件釋放，必須每週向警方報到。

exampleEn: Regular yoga practice keeps her body distinctively supple and flexible.
exampleZh: 定期練習瑜伽讓她的身體保持獨特的柔軟和靈活。

exampleEn: She went to the salon to get a manicure for her nails.
exampleZh: 她去沙龍修指甲。

exampleEn: She treated herself to a pedicure and foot massage at spa.
exampleZh: 她在水療中心享受了足部護理和足部按摩。

exampleEn: She got a facial to clean and moisturize her skin.
exampleZh: 她做了一次面部護理來清潔和滋潤皮膚。

exampleEn: He gave her a bouquet of roses.
exampleZh: 他送她一束玫瑰。

exampleEn: They plan to refurbish the old house and sell it later.
exampleZh: 他們計畫翻新這座舊房子，以後再賣掉。

exampleEn: The hotel is closed for refurbishment and will reopen next month.
exampleZh: 飯店因翻新而關閉，將於下個月重新開放。

exampleEn: The castle is surrounded by beautiful grounds and gardens to walk.
exampleZh: 城堡周圍環繞著美麗的場地和花園，可供散步。

exampleEn: The illness caused a feeling of lethargy and lack of energy.
exampleZh: 這種疾病導致了一種嗜睡和缺乏精力的感覺。

exampleEn: I felt lethargic after eating a large meal for lunch.
exampleZh: 午餐吃了一頓大餐後，我感到昏昏欲睡。

exampleEn: The cat moved lethargically in the heat of the afternoon sun.
exampleZh: 貓在下午的陽光下無精打采地移動。

exampleEn: The old mansion is a stately building with tall columns.
exampleZh: 這座古老的豪宅是一座有著高大柱子的宏偉建築。

exampleEn: We must conserve water during the drought to avoid shortages.
exampleZh: 乾旱期間我們必須節約用水以避免短缺。

exampleEn: She keeps her exotic plants in the glass conservatory in winter.
exampleZh: 冬天她把珍奇的植物養在玻璃溫室裡。

exampleEn: There was a disquieting silence in the room after the argument.
exampleZh: 爭吵後房間裡一陣令人不安的寂靜。

exampleEn: The mother bear fiercely protected her cubs from any potential threats, demonstrating the powerful instinct to safeguard offspring.
exampleZh: 母熊激烈地保護她的幼崽免受任何潛在威脅，展示了保護後代的強大本能。

exampleEn: Eating grapefruit for breakfast is healthy but can interact with certain medications.
exampleZh: 早餐吃葡萄柚很健康，但可能與某些藥物相互作用。

exampleEn: The restaurant is decorated exotically with items from foreign lands.
exampleZh: 這家餐廳裝飾著來自異國他鄉的物品。

exampleEn: He carried a flask of hot coffee on the winter hike.
exampleZh: 他在冬季徒步旅行時帶著一瓶熱咖啡。

exampleEn: The hotel room was spacious, with a large bed and a balcony.
exampleZh: 飯店房間很寬敞，有一張大床和一個陽台。

exampleEn: He is a gourmet chef who cooks delicious meals for famous people.
exampleZh: 他是一位美食廚師，為名人做美味的飯菜。

exampleEn: The magician can conjure a rabbit out of an empty hat quickly.
exampleZh: 魔術師能迅速從空帽子裡變出一隻兔子。

exampleEn: The soup was rich and creamy, perfect for a cold winter day.
exampleZh: 這湯濃郁滑膩，非常適合寒冷的冬日。

exampleEn: After swimming, we relaxed in the hot sauna for a while.
exampleZh: 游泳後，我們在熱桑拿房裡放鬆了一會兒。

exampleEn: He needs to take remedial math classes to improve his basic skills.
exampleZh: 他需要參加補習數學課來提高他的基本技能。

exampleEn: Good posture is important for keeping your back and spine healthy.
exampleZh: 良好的姿勢對於保持背部和脊柱健康很重要。

exampleEn: The doctor gave the patient medicine to sedate him before surgery.
exampleZh: 手術前醫生給病人服用了鎮靜劑。

exampleEn: The old couple walked sedately through the park, holding hands gently.
exampleZh: 這對老夫婦溫柔地手牽著手，安詳地穿過公園。

exampleEn: She clutched her bag tightly.
exampleZh: 她緊緊抓著包包。

exampleEn: The cost of the project was a staggering amount of money.
exampleZh: 該專案的成本是一筆驚人的金額。

exampleEn: The dutiful son visited his sick mother in the hospital everyday.
exampleZh: 孝順的兒子每天去醫院看望生病的母親。

exampleEn: She dutifully completed all her chores before going out to play.
exampleZh: 她出去玩之前盡職地完成了所有的家務。

exampleEn: This snack has 200 calories.
exampleZh: 這個零食有兩百卡路里。

exampleEn: They are fabulously wealthy and own houses all over the world.
exampleZh: 他們非常富有，在世界各地都擁有房子。

exampleEn: Smoking is strictly prohibited on the company premises at all times.
exampleZh: 任何時候都嚴禁在公司場所吸菸。

exampleEn: She has an eclectic taste in music, listening to jazz and rock.
exampleZh: 她在音樂方面的品味兼收並蓄，既聽爵士樂又聽搖滾樂。

exampleEn: The room was furnished eclectically with pieces from different eras.
exampleZh: 房間裡裝飾著不同時代的傢俱，風格兼收並蓄。

exampleEn: People in the village revere the old wise man for his knowledge.
exampleZh: 村里的人因老智者的淵博知識而尊敬他。

exampleEn: The Eiffel Tower is a recognizable landmark visible from far away.
exampleZh: 艾菲爾鐵塔是一個從遠處就能看到的顯著地標。

exampleEn: He was recognizably nervous, shaking slightly as he spoke clearly.
exampleZh: 他明顯很緊張，說話時微微發抖。

exampleEn: Mix the flour and eggs to make a smooth batter for pancakes.
exampleZh: 混合麵粉和雞蛋，做成光滑的煎餅麵糊。

exampleEn: The bus service runs unreliably, often arriving late or not at all.
exampleZh: 公車服務運行不可靠，經常遲到或根本不到。

exampleEn: We walked along the scenic waterfront and watched the boats sail.
exampleZh: 我們沿著風景優美的海濱散步，看著船隻航行。

exampleEn: The evidence amply demonstrates that he is innocent of the crime.
exampleZh: 證據充分證明他沒有犯罪。

exampleEn: The microphone provided amplification for the singers voice in the hall.
exampleZh: 麥克風為大廳裡的歌手聲音提供了放大功能。

exampleEn: The battered old car had many dents and scratches on it.
exampleZh: 這輛破舊的汽車上有許多凹痕和劃痕。

exampleEn: Please comply with the regulations.
exampleZh: 請遵守規定。

exampleEn: Ensure compliance with rules.
exampleZh: 確保遵守規則。

exampleEn: The company must be compliant with all safety regulations and laws.
exampleZh: 公司必須遵守所有安全法規和法律。

exampleEn: The dog followed its master compliantly without barking or pulling.
exampleZh: 狗順從地跟著主人，不叫也不拉。

exampleEn: There was a look of total blankness on his face confused.
exampleZh: 他一臉茫然，很困惑。

exampleEn: The exuberant crowd cheered loudly as the team won the game.
exampleZh: 球隊贏得比賽時，熱情的人群大聲歡呼。

exampleEn: Her youthful exuberance and energy made everyone feel happy and young.
exampleZh: 她青春的活力和精力讓每個人都感到快樂和年輕。

exampleEn: They celebrated exuberantly, dancing and singing until the early morning.
exampleZh: 他們興高采烈地慶祝，載歌載舞直到凌晨。

exampleEn: The story follows a linear narrative, starting from beginning to end.
exampleZh: 故事遵循線性敘事，從頭到尾。

exampleEn: Time moves linearly, from the past to the present and future.
exampleZh: 時間線性移動，從過去到現在和未來。

exampleEn: The arts and culture scene has flourished in the city over recent years.
exampleZh: 近年來，這座城市的藝術和文化景象蓬勃發展。

exampleEn: The ship anchored in the harbor to wait for the storm to pass.
exampleZh: 這艘船停泊在港口等待風暴過去。

exampleEn: The team's domination of the league continued for another season.
exampleZh: 球隊對聯賽的統治又持續了一個賽季。

exampleEn: Lions are the dominant predators in the African savanna ecosystem.
exampleZh: 獅子是非洲大草原生態系統中的主要捕食者。

exampleEn: He played dominantly, scoring three goals in the first half.
exampleZh: 他表現強勢，上半場進了三個球。

exampleEn: May I interject a question here before you continue speaking?
exampleZh: 在你繼續說之前，我可以插一句問個問題嗎？

exampleEn: 'Wow!' is an interjection used to express surprise or excitement.
exampleZh: “哇！”是一個感嘆詞，用來表示驚訝或興奮。

exampleEn: Water began to gush from the broken pipe onto the street.
exampleZh: 水開始從破裂的水管湧到街上。

exampleEn: She was gushing about how wonderful her new boyfriend is.
exampleZh: 她滔滔不絕地講她的新男朋友有多棒。

exampleEn: He spoke gushingly of his admiration for the famous actress.
exampleZh: 他滔滔不絕地表達了對這位著名女演員的欽佩。

exampleEn: He has a voracious appetite and can eat three pizzas alone.
exampleZh: 他胃口很大，可以獨自吃三個披薩。

exampleEn: The hungry dog ate the food voraciously in seconds flat.
exampleZh: 飢餓的狗幾秒鐘內就狼吞虎嚥地吃完了食物。

exampleEn: The artist carries a sketchbook everywhere to draw new ideas.
exampleZh: 這位藝術家隨身攜帶速寫本來畫新點子。

exampleEn: He used a stick to prop open the heavy window slightly.
exampleZh: 他用棍子把沉重的窗戶稍微撐開。

exampleEn: The little boy acted like a mischievous imp, hiding keys.
exampleZh: 小男孩表現得像個淘氣的小鬼，把鑰匙藏了起來。

exampleEn: She had an impish grin on her face after playing a prank.
exampleZh: 惡作劇後，她臉上帶著頑皮的笑容。

exampleEn: He smiled impishly as he told the funny joke to us.
exampleZh: 他給我們講這趣笑話時頑皮地笑了。

exampleEn: The wicked witch cast a spell on the princess in the story.
exampleZh: 故事中邪惡的女巫對公主施了咒語。

exampleEn: He laughed wickedly as his evil plan started to work.
exampleZh: 當他的邪惡計畫開始奏效時，他邪惡地笑了。

exampleEn: The movie had a macabre theme involving ghosts and death.
exampleZh: 這部電影有一個涉及鬼魂和死亡的恐怖主題。

exampleEn: He ate the meal with great gusto, enjoying every bite.
exampleZh: 他津津有味地吃著這頓飯，享受每一口。

exampleEn: His refusal to answer was tantamount to admitting his guilt.
exampleZh: 他拒絕回答等同於承認自己有罪。

exampleEn: The clown's funny antics made the children laugh loudly at party.
exampleZh: 小丑滑稽的動作讓派對上的孩子們大笑起來。

exampleEn: He suffered a relapse of the flu after returning to work early.
exampleZh: 早早復工後，他的流感復發了。

exampleEn: The heavy snow will impede our progress reaching the mountain top.
exampleZh: 大雪將阻礙我們到達山頂的進程。

exampleEn: His lack of confidence was a major impediment to his success.
exampleZh: 缺乏自信是他成功的主要障礙。

exampleEn: Pull the rope taut so that it doesn't sag in middle.
exampleZh: 把繩子拉緊，這樣中間就不會下垂。

exampleEn: The skin on the drum was stretched tautly for better sound.
exampleZh: 鼓皮被拉得很緊以獲得更好的聲音。

exampleEn: He wore his favorite football team's jersey to the match.
exampleZh: 他穿著他最喜歡的足球隊的球衣去觀看比賽。

exampleEn: The news of his resignation came as a startling surprise to us.
exampleZh: 他辭職的消息讓我們大吃一驚。

exampleEn: She bears a startlingly close resemblance to her mother.
exampleZh: 她長得和她母親驚人地相似。

exampleEn: The rope went slack when he stopped pulling on it.
exampleZh: 當他停止拉繩子時，繩子鬆了。

exampleEn: He held the reins slackly, letting the horse choose the path.
exampleZh: 他鬆鬆地握著韁繩，讓馬選擇路徑。

exampleEn: She has unwavering support from her family in everything she does.
exampleZh: 她所做的每一件事都得到家人堅定不移的支持。

exampleEn: He stared unwaveringly at the target before taking the shot.
exampleZh: 射擊前，他堅定地盯著目標。

exampleEn: His house is located in a quiet area far removed from city.
exampleZh: 他的房子位於遠離城市的安靜區域。

exampleEn: He acted like a buffoon at the party to make people laugh.
exampleZh: 他在派對上表現得像個小丑，讓人發笑。

exampleEn: She has a beguiling smile that charms everyone she meets.
exampleZh: 她有著迷人的微笑，迷住了她遇到的每一個人。

exampleEn: The advertisement was beguilingly simple but very effective.
exampleZh: 這則廣告簡單得令人著迷，但非常有效。

exampleEn: She blithely ignored the warning signs and walked into danger.
exampleZh: 她漫不經心地無視警告標誌，走進了危險之中。

exampleEn: A stray dog wandered into our yard looking for food.
exampleZh: 一隻流浪狗游盪進我們的院子尋找食物。

exampleEn: Dragons are mythological creatures that appear in many old stories.
exampleZh: 龍是出現在許多古老故事中的神話生物。

exampleEn: Greek mythology is full of stories about gods and heroes.
exampleZh: 希臘神話充滿了關於神和英雄的故事。

exampleEn: Some cultures venerate their ancestors and seek their guidance.
exampleZh: 有些文化崇敬祖先並尋求他們的指導。

exampleEn: The temple was built in veneration of the sun god.
exampleZh: 這座寺廟是為了崇敬太陽神而建的。

exampleEn: It is not ethical for a doctor to reveal patient secrets.
exampleZh: 醫生洩露病人秘密是不道德的。

exampleEn: The company strives to act ethically in all its business dealings.
exampleZh: 公司努力在所有商業交易中合乎道德地行事。

exampleEn: She is the heroine of the story who saves the day.
exampleZh: 她是故事中力挽狂瀾的女英雄。

exampleEn: A cold glass of lemonade is very refreshing on a hot day.
exampleZh: 在炎熱的日子裡，一杯冰檸檬水非常清爽。

exampleEn: They had a zany idea to dress up as fruits for Halloween.
exampleZh: 他們有一個滑稽的想法，萬聖節打扮成水果。

exampleEn: He is a devotee of classical music and attends concerts often.
exampleZh: 他是古典音樂的愛好者，經常參加音樂會。

exampleEn: She applied a soothing salve to the burn on her hand.
exampleZh: 她在手上的燒傷處塗了一種舒緩的藥膏。

exampleEn: Religion offers hope and salvation to many believers worldwide.
exampleZh: 宗教為全世界許多信徒提供了希望和救贖。

exampleEn: Divers tried to salvage valuable items from the sunken ship.
exampleZh: 潛水員試圖從沈船中打撈貴重物品。

exampleEn: The rapid staccato sound of gunfire echoed through the streets.
exampleZh: 急促斷續的槍聲在街道上迴蕩。

exampleEn: She performed the dance with great verve and energy.
exampleZh: 她充滿活力和精力地表演了舞蹈。

exampleEn: A motley crew of sailors gathered on the deck of the ship.
exampleZh: 一群形形色色的水手聚集在船的甲板上。

exampleEn: The priest preaches a sermon about love and forgiveness every Sunday.
exampleZh: 牧師每週日都會宣講關於愛和寬恕的布道。

exampleEn: The traveling preacher spoke to crowds in every town he visited.
exampleZh: 這位巡迴傳教士向他訪問的每個城鎮的人群發表演講。

exampleEn: He was justly punished for the crimes he committed against others.
exampleZh: 他因對他人犯下的罪行而受到應有的懲罰。

exampleEn: He gave a wry smile as he admitted his mistake.
exampleZh: 他承認錯誤時露出苦笑。

exampleEn: She commented wryly on the terrible weather we were having.
exampleZh: 她挖苦地評論了我們這糟糕的天氣。

exampleEn: The famous poetess read her poems to an admiring audience.
exampleZh: 這位著名的女詩人向仰慕的聽眾朗讀了她的詩。

exampleEn: She confided her secret to her best friend, trusting her completely.
exampleZh: 她向最好的朋友吐露了秘密，完全信任她。

exampleEn: Humans are sentient beings capable of feeling and thinking deeply.
exampleZh: 人類是有知覺的生物，能夠深刻地感受和思考。

exampleEn: Public sentiment has turned against the war in recent months.
exampleZh: 近幾個月來，公眾情緒已轉向反對戰爭。

exampleEn: She kept the old letters for sentimental reasons, remembering past.
exampleZh: 出於情感原因，她保留了舊信，回憶過去。

exampleEn: He spoke sentimentally about his childhood home and memories there.
exampleZh: 他感傷地談到了他童年的家和那裡的記憶。

exampleEn: Her long hair got into a tangle in the strong wind.
exampleZh: 她的長髮在強風中糾結在一起。

exampleEn: The fishing line got tangled up in the weeds underwater.
exampleZh: 魚線在水下被雜草纏住了。

exampleEn: It took an hour to untangle the Christmas lights.
exampleZh: 花了一個小時才解開聖誕燈。

exampleEn: She patiently untangled the knots in the necklace chain.
exampleZh: 她耐心地解開項鍊鏈上的結。

exampleEn: She is very perceptive and noticed that I was feeling sad.
exampleZh: 她很有洞察力，注意到我很傷心。

exampleEn: He perceptively analyzed the situation and found a solution quickly.
exampleZh: 他敏銳地分析了情況，並迅速找到了解決方案。

exampleEn: From the outset, we knew that the project would be difficult.
exampleZh: 從一開始，我們就知道這個專案會很困難。

exampleEn: The business tycoon owns several companies and a private jet.
exampleZh: 這位商業大亨擁有多家公司和一架私人飛機。

exampleEn: The video game engrossed him so much he forgot to eat.
exampleZh: 電子遊戲讓他如此著迷，以至於他忘了吃飯。

exampleEn: The book was so engrossing that I finished it in one day.
exampleZh: 這本書太引人入勝了，我一天就看完了。

exampleEn: The beach was littered with plastic detritus washed up by sea.
exampleZh: 海灘上到處都是海水衝上來的塑膠碎屑。

exampleEn: Smoking is a detriment to your health and should be avoided.
exampleZh: 吸菸對健康有害，應避免。

exampleEn: Lack of sleep can be detrimental to your mental health.
exampleZh: 缺乏睡眠會對你的心理健康有害。

exampleEn: The scandal affected the company's reputation detrimentally and sales dropped.
exampleZh: 醜聞對公司的聲譽造成了不利影響，銷售額下降。

exampleEn: The product is sold both domestically and internationally.
exampleZh: 該產品在國內和國際上都有銷售。

exampleEn: Humans began to domesticate animals like dogs thousands of years ago.
exampleZh: 人類在幾千年前就開始馴化像狗這樣的動物。

exampleEn: The domestication of plants allowed for settled agriculture to begin.
exampleZh: 植物的馴化使定居農業得以開始。

exampleEn: He dressed eccentrically in mismatched clothes and bright colors.
exampleZh: 他穿著不協調的衣服和鮮豔的顏色，打扮得很古怪。

exampleEn: The accident rendered the car completely useless and totaled.
exampleZh: 事故導致汽車完全報廢。

exampleEn: The artist's rendering of the building showed what it will look.
exampleZh: 藝術家對建築的渲染圖展示了它將來的樣子。

exampleEn: The movie was full of pathos, making the audience cry.
exampleZh: 這部電影充滿了悲情，讓觀眾流淚。

exampleEn: The tailor measured him for a custom-made suit for wedding.
exampleZh: 裁縫為他量身定做了一套婚禮西裝。

exampleEn: You can personalize your phone with a custom case and wallpaper.
exampleZh: 您可以用定製的外殼和壁紙個性化您的手機。

exampleEn: The website offers personalization options to suit your preferences.
exampleZh: 該網站提供個性化選項以滿足您的喜好。

exampleEn: The possibilities for learning on the internet are seemingly limitless.
exampleZh: 互聯網上的學習可能性似乎是無限的。

exampleEn: He's an apprentice chef.
exampleZh: 他是廚師學徒。

exampleEn: She's doing an apprenticeship.
exampleZh: 她在當學徒。

exampleEn: The surgeon operated with great precision and steady hands.
exampleZh: 外科醫生以極高的精確度和穩定的雙手進行手術。

exampleEn: We saw the silhouette of a bird against the setting sun.
exampleZh: 我們看到一隻鳥在夕陽下的剪影。

exampleEn: He drove a nondescript car that didn't stand out at all.
exampleZh: 他開著一輛毫不起眼的車，一點也不引人注目。

exampleEn: The difference in price between the two items is negligible.
exampleZh: 這兩件物品之間的價格差異可以忽略不計。

exampleEn: The driver was negligent for not stopping at the red light.
exampleZh: 司機因沒在紅燈前停車而疏忽大意。

exampleEn: He negligently left the door unlocked when he went out.
exampleZh: 他出門時疏忽地沒鎖門。

exampleEn: The book is aimed principally at university students studying history.
exampleZh: 這本書主要針對學習歷史的大學生。

exampleEn: His altruism led him to donate most of his money to charity.
exampleZh: 他的利他主義促使他將大部分錢捐給了慈善機構。

exampleEn: She has an altruistic nature and always puts others first.
exampleZh: 她有著利他的本性，總是把別人放在第一位。

exampleEn: In the worst-case scenario, we will lose all our data.
exampleZh: 在最壞的情況下，我們將丟失所有數據。

exampleEn: Attendance at the meeting is voluntary, not mandatory for staff.
exampleZh: 參加會議是自願的，不是員工必須參加的。

exampleEn: He voluntarily cleaned up the park without being asked to.
exampleZh: 他無人要求便自願清理公園。

exampleEn: Farmers reap the harvest in the autumn after a long season.
exampleZh: 經過漫長的季節，農民在秋天收穫莊稼。

exampleEn: He took a paternal interest in the boy's education and future.
exampleZh: 他對男孩的教育和未來表現出父親般的關懷。

exampleEn: She has a strong maternal instinct and loves caring for children.
exampleZh: 她有強烈的母性本能，喜歡照顧孩子。

exampleEn: The company adopted a maternalistic approach, caring for employees.
exampleZh: 公司採取了一種母愛般的方式，關愛員工。

exampleEn: His paternalistic leadership style was seen as controlling by some.
exampleZh: 他家長式的領導風格被一些人視為控制欲強。

exampleEn: They packed enough provisions for a week-long camping trip.
exampleZh: 他們為為期一週的露營旅行打包了足夠的口糧。

exampleEn: They fought against the injustice of the unfair laws.
exampleZh: 他們與不公平法律的不公正作鬥爭。

exampleEn: The charity helps impoverished families with food and shelter.
exampleZh: 該慈善機構為貧困家庭提供食物和住所。

exampleEn: Current levels of fishing are unsustainable and deplete fish stocks.
exampleZh: 目前的捕撈水平是不可持續的，會耗盡魚類種群。

exampleEn: The forest is being logged unsustainably, damaging the ecosystem.
exampleZh: 森林正在被不可持續地砍伐，破壞了生態系統。

exampleEn: Solar power is a sustainable energy source that is clean.
exampleZh: 太陽能是一種清潔的可持續能源。

exampleEn: We try to live sustainably by recycling and using less energy.
exampleZh: 我們試圖通過回收和減少能源使用來過可持續的生活。

exampleEn: We took the bypass to avoid traffic.
exampleZh: 我們走外環道避開交通。

exampleEn: He is a cynic who believes that everyone is selfish.
exampleZh: 他是一個憤世嫉俗的人，認為每個人都是自私的。

exampleEn: She has a cynical view of politics and doesn't vote.
exampleZh: 她對政治持憤世嫉俗的看法，不投票。

exampleEn: He laughed cynically at the idea of world peace forever.
exampleZh: 他對世界永久和平的想法憤世嫉俗地大笑。

exampleEn: Her cynicism makes it hard for her to trust new people.
exampleZh: 她的憤世嫉俗使她很難信任新認識的人。

exampleEn: His voice was full of sarcasm when he made that joke.
exampleZh: 他開那個玩笑時，聲音裡充滿了諷刺。

exampleEn: Don't be so sarcastic; I was only trying to help you.
exampleZh: 別這麼諷刺；我只是想幫你。

exampleEn: She clapped sarcastically after his terrible performance ended.
exampleZh: 他糟糕的表演結束後，她諷刺地鼓掌。

exampleEn: I tend to misplace my keys and spend hours looking for them.
exampleZh: 我經常把鑰匙放錯地方，花幾個小時找它們。

exampleEn: The fever is symptomatic of the infection in your body.
exampleZh: 發燒是你體內感染的症狀。

exampleEn: Pollution can degrade the quality of the soil and water.
exampleZh: 污染會降低土壤和水的質量。

exampleEn: It was a degrading experience to be treated so poorly.
exampleZh: 受到如此惡劣的對待是一種有辱人格的經歷。

exampleEn: The degradation of the environment is a serious global issue.
exampleZh: 環境惡化是一個嚴重的全球問題。

exampleEn: We had a lively discourse about politics and current events.
exampleZh: 我們就政治和時事進行了熱烈的討論。

exampleEn: He stayed calm amid the chaos and confusion of the emergency.
exampleZh: 在緊急情況的混亂和困惑中，他保持冷靜。

exampleEn: The hedgehog rolled into a ball to protect itself from danger.
exampleZh: 刺蝟縮成一團以保護自己免受危險。

exampleEn: Owls are nocturnal birds that hunt for food at night.
exampleZh: 貓頭鷹是夜間活動的鳥類，在夜間獵食。

exampleEn: Bears hibernate in caves during the cold winter months.
exampleZh: 熊在寒冷的冬季在洞穴中冬眠。

exampleEn: The animal woke up from hibernation when spring arrived.
exampleZh: 春天到來時，動物從冬眠中醒來。

exampleEn: The jury convicted him of murder.
exampleZh: 陪審團判他謀殺罪成立。

exampleEn: He spoke with conviction.
exampleZh: 他堅定地說話。

exampleEn: He has a latent talent for music that he hasn't developed yet.
exampleZh: 他有一種尚未開發的音樂潛能。

exampleEn: I hit the snooze button on my alarm clock three times.
exampleZh: 我按了三次鬧鐘上的貪睡按鈕。

exampleEn: She wore a classy black dress to the evening gala.
exampleZh: 她穿著一件優雅的黑色連衣裙參加晚會。

exampleEn: He used a wrench to tighten the bolts on the tire.
exampleZh: 他用扳手擰緊輪胎上的螺栓。

exampleEn: They like to reminisce about their college days together.
exampleZh: 他們喜歡一起回憶大學時代。

exampleEn: The smell of baking bread is reminiscent of my grandmother's kitchen.
exampleZh: 烤麵包的味道讓我想起了祖母的廚房。

exampleEn: She could intuit that he was lying without any proof.
exampleZh: 沒有任何證據，她也能憑直覺感到他在撒謊。

exampleEn: Trust your intuition when making difficult decisions in life.
exampleZh: 在生活中做出艱難決定時，相信你的直覺。

exampleEn: The software interface is intuitive and easy to use for beginners.
exampleZh: 該軟體界面直觀，便於初學者使用。

exampleEn: He intuitively knew which path to take in the dark forest.
exampleZh: 他憑直覺知道在黑暗的森林裡該走哪條路。

exampleEn: There was only a marginal improvement in his test scores.
exampleZh: 他的考試成績只有微小的提高。

exampleEn: The new model is only marginally faster than the old one.
exampleZh: 新模型僅比舊模型快一點點。

exampleEn: They built a crude shelter out of branches and leaves.
exampleZh: 他們用樹枝和樹葉建造了一個簡陋的避難所。

exampleEn: The message was crudely written on the wall with spray paint.
exampleZh: 這條訊息是用噴漆粗略地寫在牆上的。

exampleEn: He fastened the strap of his helmet before riding the bike.
exampleZh: 騎自行車前，他繫好了頭盔的帶子。

exampleEn: He is a strapping young man, tall and strong.
exampleZh: 他是一個魁梧的年輕人，又高又壯。

exampleEn: They scoffed at his idea, thinking it was impossible to do.
exampleZh: 他們嘲笑他的主意，認為這是不可能做到的。

exampleEn: Fixing the small watch parts was a fiddly job to do.
exampleZh: 修理小手錶零件是一項繁瑣的工作。

exampleEn: The fiddler played a lively tune on his violin for dancers.
exampleZh: 小提琴手用他的小提琴為舞者演奏了一首歡快的曲子。

exampleEn: Stop fiddling with your pen and pay attention to the class.
exampleZh: 別擺弄你的鋼筆了，專心聽課。

exampleEn: He is completely unmusical and cannot sing a tune correctly.
exampleZh: 他完全不通音律，唱不準調子。

exampleEn: He sang unmusically loud in the shower every morning.
exampleZh: 他每天早上淋浴時都五音不全地大聲唱歌。

exampleEn: The theater company has a wide repertory of plays to perform.
exampleZh: 該劇團有廣泛的劇目可供表演。

exampleEn: The orchestra performed a beautiful piano concerto by Mozart.
exampleZh: 管弦樂隊演奏了莫扎特的一首優美的鋼琴協奏曲。

exampleEn: She is the premier dancer in the ballet company right now.
exampleZh: 她是目前芭蕾舞團的首席舞者。

exampleEn: He is a fitness fanatic who exercises for hours every day.
exampleZh: 他是一個健身狂，每天鍛鍊幾個小時。

exampleEn: She is fanatically dedicated to her work and never rests.
exampleZh: 她對工作狂熱地投入，從不休息。

exampleEn: The concert hall is acoustically designed for perfect sound quality.
exampleZh: 音樂廳的聲學設計旨在獲得完美的音質。

exampleEn: This is an acoustic guitar.
exampleZh: 這是木吉他。

exampleEn: The acoustics of the room are excellent for recording music.
exampleZh: 這個房間的聲學效果非常適合錄製音樂。

exampleEn: The security of the system was compromised by hackers.
exampleZh: 系統的安全性遭到了駭客的破壞。

exampleEn: The size of the task did not daunt him; he started immediately.
exampleZh: 任務的規模並沒有嚇倒他；他立即開始了。

exampleEn: It was a daunting challenge, but she was ready to face it.
exampleZh: 這是一個艱鉅的挑戰，但她準備好面對它了。

exampleEn: As a realist, he focuses on practical solutions rather than dreams.
exampleZh: 作為一個現實主義者，他專注於實際的解決方案而不是夢想。

exampleEn: The artist Painted with such realism that the fruit looked real.
exampleZh: 藝術家畫得如此逼真，以至於水果看起來像真的一樣。

exampleEn: Blue eyes are a recessive gene compared to brown eyes.
exampleZh: 與棕色眼睛相比，藍色眼睛是隱性基因。

exampleEn: She is a prolific writer who publishes three books every year.
exampleZh: 她是一位多產的作家，每年出版三本書。

exampleZh: 在他漫長而成功的職業生涯中，他創作了大量的音樂。

exampleZh: 戰爭導致該國分裂成較小的國家。

exampleZh: 這封信在郵寄中丟失了，從未送達。

exampleEn: Jeans are made of durable fabric that lasts for years.
exampleZh: 牛仔褲是由耐用的面料製成的，可以使用多年。

exampleZh: 明天很有可能下雨，所以帶把傘。

exampleEn: He was naive to believe that he could get rich quickly.
exampleZh: 他天真地相信自己能很快致富。

exampleZh: 他的天真導致他在生意上犯了很多錯誤。

exampleEn: The coat is impervious to water, keeping you dry in rain.
exampleZh: 這件外套不透水，讓你在雨中保持乾燥。

exampleZh: 認為外星人建造了金字塔是荒謬的。

exampleZh: 對於一部電影來說，票價貴得離譜。

exampleZh: 太陽能電池板是家庭發電的一種具有成本效益的方式。

exampleEn: The movie contained some gruesome scenes of violence and blood.
exampleZh: 這部電影包含一些暴力和血腥的恐怖場景。

exampleEn: The guests began to mingle and talk to each other at party.
exampleZh: 客人們開始在聚會上互相交流。

exampleZh: 船向前移動時，螺旋槳攪動著水。

exampleEn: Trees act as a buffer against the strong winds from sea.

exampleEn: The irate customer demanded to speak to the manager immediately.
exampleZh: 憤怒的顧客要求立即與經理交談。

exampleEn: He spoke irately about the poor service he received at restaurant.

exampleEn: The dog is very docile and easy to train for tricks.

exampleEn: She followed instructions docilely without asking any questions.

exampleEn: He is a crossword puzzle fiend and does one every day.
exampleZh: 他是一個填字遊戲迷，每天都做一個。

exampleZh: 這個謎題非常難解，花了幾個小時。

exampleZh: 他想出了一個極其聰明的計畫來欺騙他們。

exampleEn: The audience sat transfixed by the amazing magic show performance.

exampleEn: She has a calm temperament and rarely gets angry or upset.
exampleZh: 她性情冷靜，很少生氣或難過。

exampleEn: They are temperamentally unsuited for each other and argue often.
exampleZh: 他們性情不合，經常爭吵。

exampleEn: He wrote the screenplay for the award-winning movie last year.
exampleZh: 去年他為這部獲獎電影寫了劇本。

exampleEn: Her disillusionment with the government grew after the scandal.
exampleZh: 醜聞發生後，她對政府的幻滅感與日俱增。

exampleEn: Read the synopsis on the back cover to see if you like it.
exampleZh: 閱讀封底的簡介，看看你是否喜歡它。

exampleEn: She gained international renown for her scientific discoveries.
exampleZh: 她因科學發現而享譽國際。

exampleEn: The election results were contested by the losing candidate.
exampleZh: 落選的候選人對選舉結果提出了異議。

exampleEn: We sat on the verandah and watched the sunset in evening.
exampleZh: 傍晚我們坐在陽台上看日落。

exampleZh: 背痛是卡車司機常見的職業危害。

exampleZh: 經過數小時的審議，陪審團做出了有罪判決。

exampleEn: Please ventilate the room by opening all the windows wide.
exampleZh: 請把所有的窗戶都打開，讓房間通風。

exampleEn: The room has poor ventilation and feels very stuffy inside.
exampleZh: 這房間通風不好，感覺很悶。

exampleEn: The previous occupant of the house left it in good condition.
exampleZh: 房子的前任住戶把它得很好。

exampleEn: The radiator keeps the room warm during the cold winter.
exampleZh: 散熱器在寒冷的冬天保持房間溫暖。

exampleEn: The hotel has a homely atmosphere that makes you feel comfortable.
exampleZh: 飯店有一種像家一樣的氛圍，讓你感覺很舒服。

exampleEn: The process is too bureaucratic.
exampleZh: 這個過程太官僚了。

exampleZh: 這個過程官僚主義複雜，花了幾個月才完成。

exampleEn: The seat is adjustable.
exampleZh: 座位可調整。

exampleEn: After working twelve-hour shifts for an entire week, the nurse was suffering from severe fatigue and desperately needed rest.
exampleZh: 在整整一週工作十二小時輪班後，這位護士遭受嚴重疲勞，迫切需要休息。

exampleEn: He has a muscular body from lifting weights at the gym.
exampleZh: 他在健身房舉重，身體肌肉發達。

exampleEn: This kitchen tool is versatile and can peel, slice, and dice.
exampleZh: 這種廚房工具用途廣泛，可以削皮、切片和切丁。

exampleEn: Her versatility as an actress allows her to play many roles.
exampleZh: 作為一名女演員，她的多才多藝使她能夠扮演許多角色。

exampleEn: Plants respond to external stimuli like light and water.
exampleZh: 植物對光和水等外部刺激有反應。

exampleEn: The lecture was dull and uninspiring, and students fell asleep.
exampleZh: 講座枯燥乏味，學生們都睡著了。

exampleEn: Comparing notes was mutually beneficial for both students.
exampleZh: 比較筆記對兩個學生都有利。

exampleEn: The funeral was a somber occasion with everyone dressed in black.
exampleZh: 葬禮是一個莊嚴的場合，每個人都穿著黑色的衣服。

exampleEn: They nodded somberly as the bad news was announced to them.
exampleZh: 當壞消息宣布給他們時，他們嚴肅地點點頭。

exampleEn: Please clear the clutter off your desk so you can work.
exampleZh: 請清理掉你桌子上的雜物，這樣你就可以工作了。

exampleEn: He tried to dislodge the stuck rock with a long stick.
exampleZh: 他試圖用一根長棍子把卡住的石頭弄走。

exampleEn: The carpenter built a table.
exampleZh: 木匠做了一張桌子。

exampleEn: He learned carpentry skills to build his own furniture at home.
exampleZh: 他學習木工技能，在家裡自己製作傢俱。

exampleEn: The goods were damaged in transit from the factory to shop.
exampleZh: 貨物在從工廠到商店的運輸過程中受損。

exampleEn: Stock prices plummeted after the company announced huge losses.
exampleZh: 在公司宣布鉅額虧損後，股價暴跌。

exampleEn: Blood circulates through the body.
exampleZh: 血液在體內循環。

exampleEn: Exercise improves circulation.

exampleEn: The demography of the city is changing with new immigrants.
exampleZh: 隨著新移民的到來，這座城市的人口統計數據正在發生變化。

exampleZh: 該產品的目標人群是年輕人。

exampleEn: The area is demographically diverse with people from many backgrounds.
exampleZh: 該地區人口結構多樣，有來自各種背景的人。

exampleEn: The success of the new movie has been absolutely phenomenal.
exampleZh: 這部新電影的成功絕對是驚人的。

exampleEn: The business grew phenomenally fast in its first year.
exampleZh: 這項業務在第一年增長驚人地快。

exampleEn: Her warnings turned out to be prophetic when the disaster happened.
exampleZh: 當災難發生時，她的警告變成了預言。

exampleEn: You have to subscribe to bypass the paywall and read article.
exampleZh: 你必須訂閱才能繞過付費牆閱讀文章。

exampleEn: The company installed a firewall to protect its computer network.
exampleZh: 公司安裝了防火牆來保護其計算機網絡。

exampleEn: Please pay the invoice within thirty days of receiving it.
exampleZh: 請在收到發票後三十天內付款。

exampleEn: The demolition of the old building took only a few days.
exampleZh: 舊大樓的拆除只花了幾天時間。

exampleEn: He gave a demo of the new software to the clients.
exampleZh: 他向客戶演示了新軟體。

exampleEn: The band played a gig at a local club last night.
exampleZh: 樂隊昨晚在當地俱樂部演出。

exampleEn: School plays an important role in the socialization of children.
exampleZh: 學校在兒童社會化過程中扮演著重要角色。

exampleEn: The museum contains many valuable objects from antiquity.
exampleZh: 博物館收藏了許多古代珍貴文物。

exampleEn: The computer system is antiquated and needs to be replaced.
exampleZh: 計算機系統陳舊，需要更換。

exampleZh: 舊畫的修復揭示了它原來的顏色。

exampleEn: She finds yoga to be very restorative for her mind and body.
exampleZh: 她發現瑜伽對她的身心很有恢復作用。

exampleEn: The earth rotates on its axis once every twenty-four hours.
exampleZh: 地球每二十四小時自轉一次。

exampleEn: Low wages coupled with high prices made life difficult for many.
exampleZh: 低工資加上高物價使許多人的生活變得困難。

exampleEn: We planned our travel itinerary carefully to see everything.
exampleZh: 我們仔細規劃了旅行行程，以便看遍一切。

exampleEn: The company has a charter flight.
exampleZh: 公司有包機。

exampleEn: The rugged terrain made it difficult for vehicles to pass.
exampleZh: 崎嶇的地形使車輛難以通過。

exampleEn: She is very resilient and bounces back quickly from setbacks.
exampleZh: 她很有彈性，很快就能從挫折中恢復過來。

exampleZh: 這場毀滅性的洪水過後，社區展現了巨大的韌性。

exampleEn: The enterprising student started a small business selling snacks.

exampleZh: 信任是任何健康關係中不可或缺的一部分。

exampleEn: We paddled the canoe across the lake.
exampleZh: 我們划獨木舟過湖。

exampleEn: He has a magnetic personality that attracts people to him.
exampleZh: 他有一種吸引人到他身邊的磁性人格。

exampleEn: The magnetism of the earth guides the compass needle north.
exampleZh: 地球的磁力引導指南針指向北方。

exampleEn: The door is held shut magnetically and opens with a push.
exampleZh: 門是磁性關閉的，一推就開。

exampleEn: The witness provided a credible account of the accident details.
exampleZh: 證人對事故細節作了可信的描述。

exampleEn: He could not credibly explain where the missing money went.
exampleZh: 他無法令人信服地解釋丟失的錢去哪了。

exampleEn: The scandal damaged the politician's credibility with voters.
exampleZh: 醜聞損害了這位政治家在選民中的信譽。

exampleEn: She has excellent credentials for the job, including a PhD.
exampleZh: 她有極好的工作證書，包括博士學位。

exampleEn: He was acutely aware of the danger he was in.
exampleZh: 他敏銳地意識到自己處於危險之中。

exampleEn: The cost of the new car was prohibitive for most people.
exampleZh: 這輛新車的價格對大多數人來說是望而卻步的。

exampleEn: House prices in the city are prohibitively high for young couples.
exampleZh: 城市的房價對年輕夫婦來說高得讓人望而卻步。

exampleEn: A deep fissure appeared in the ground after the earthquake.
exampleZh: 地震後地面出現了一條深裂縫。

exampleEn: The dog had long, pendulous ears that dragged on the ground.
exampleZh: 這隻狗有長長的、下垂的耳朵，拖在地板上。

exampleEn: The suspension of the player lasted for three games.
exampleZh: 這名球員的禁賽持續了三場比賽。

exampleEn: He is studying anthropology to understand different human cultures.
exampleZh: 他正在學習人類學以了解不同的人類文化。

exampleEn: The anthropologist lived with the tribe to study their customs.
exampleZh: 人類學家與部落住在一起研究他們的習俗。

exampleEn: Don't squander your money on things you don't need.
exampleZh: 不要把錢浪費在你不需要的東西上。

exampleEn: He likes to munch on popcorn while watching movies at home.
exampleZh: 他喜歡在家看電影時嚼爆米花。

exampleEn: The two rooms adjoin each other with a connecting door.
exampleZh: 這兩個房間彼此相鄰，有一扇連通門。

exampleEn: We have adjoining rooms.
exampleZh: 我們有相連的房間。

exampleEn: The wizened old man sat on the porch telling stories.
exampleZh: 乾癟的老人坐在門廊上講故事。

exampleEn: The gardener grafted a branch from one tree onto another.
exampleZh: 園丁把一棵樹的樹枝嫁接到另一棵樹上。

exampleEn: They picked apples in the orchard on a sunny autumn day.
exampleZh: 在一個陽光明媚的秋日，他們在果園裡摘蘋果。

exampleEn: She planted the tomato seedling in a pot on the balcony.
exampleZh: 她在陽台的花盆裡種了番茄幼苗。

exampleEn: The company bought a large tract of land for development.
exampleZh: 該公司購買了大片土地用於開發。

exampleEn: The grandmother told a traditional folktale to the children.
exampleZh: 祖母給孩子們講了一個傳統民間故事。

exampleEn: The seeds began to sprout after a few days of rain.
exampleZh: 幾天雨後，種子開始發芽。

exampleEn: He criticized her for the vary same hypocrisy he showed himself.
exampleZh: 他批評她的虛偽，而他自己也表現出同樣的虛偽。

exampleEn: He is a hypocrite who says one thing and does another.
exampleZh: 他是一個言行不一的偽君子。

exampleEn: It is hypocritical to tell others not to smoke while smoking.
exampleZh: 一邊吸菸一邊告訴別人不要吸菸是虛偽的。

exampleEn: She smiled hypocritically at her rival while plotting against her.
exampleZh: 她對這對手虛偽地微笑，同時密謀反對她。

exampleEn: The midwife helped the woman deliver her baby at home safely.
exampleZh: 助產士幫助婦女在家安全分娩。

exampleEn: The product was not commercially successful despite good reviews.
exampleZh: 儘管評價很好，但該產品在商業上並不成功。

exampleEn: The rows of houses showed a boring uniformity in design.
exampleZh: 成排的房子在設計上表現出乏味的統一性。

exampleEn: My fingers went numb from the cold while playing in snow.
exampleZh: 在雪地裡玩耍時，我的手指凍僵了。

exampleEn: Spicy food can sometimes burn your tastebuds if you aren't careful.
exampleZh: 如果不小心，辛辣食物有時會灼傷味蕾。

exampleEn: He's an amateur photographer.
exampleZh: 他是業餘攝影師。

exampleEn: We had to retrace our steps to find the lost trail.
exampleZh: 我們不得不折回原路尋找丟失的小徑。

exampleEn: The insubordinate soldier refused to follow the officer's orders.
exampleZh: 不服從命令的士兵拒絕服從軍官的命令。

exampleEn: He was fired for gross insubordination and disrespect to boss.
exampleZh: 他因嚴重不服從和對老闆不敬而被解僱。

exampleEn: He acted insubordinately by ignoring the rules set by manager.
exampleZh: 他無視經理制定的規則，表現得不服從。

exampleEn: He treats his subordinates with respect and kindness always.
exampleZh: 他總是尊重和善待下屬。

exampleEn: The camp was primitively equipped with no electricity or running water.
exampleZh: 營地裝備簡陋，沒有電也沒有自來水。

exampleEn: We are about to embark on a new adventure together.
exampleZh: 我們即將一起開始新的冒險。

exampleEn: Please expedite the shipping of my order as I need it.
exampleZh: 請加快我的訂單發貨，因為我需要它。

exampleEn: Contextual clues help you understand the meaning of new words.
exampleZh: 上下文線索有助於你理解新單詞的含義。

exampleEn: The word must be interpreted contextually to make sense.
exampleZh: 這個詞必須根據上下文來解釋才有意義。

exampleEn: He read the newspaper whilst waiting for his train to arrive.
exampleZh: 他在等火車的時候看報紙。

exampleEn: The driver performed a difficult maneuver to park the car.
exampleZh: 司機做了一個艱難的動作來停車。

exampleEn: The movie was riveting, and I couldn't take my eyes off.
exampleZh: 這部電影很吸引人，我無法將目光移開。

exampleEn: He took a deep breath and plunged into the cold water.
exampleZh: 他深吸一口氣，跳進冷水裡。

exampleEn: The singer made her debut on stage at the age of ten.
exampleZh: 這位歌手十歲時首次登台演出。

exampleEn: The country was in political turmoil after the sudden coup.
exampleZh: 突然政變後，國家陷入政治動盪。

exampleEn: She wrote a scathing review of the restaurant's terrible food.
exampleZh: 她寫了一篇嚴厲的評論，批評這家餐廳糟糕的食物。

exampleEn: Despite the harsh criticism, his reputation remained unscathed.
exampleZh: 儘管受到嚴厲批評，他的聲譽仍未受損。

exampleEn: The plot of the movie was so convoluted I couldn't follow.
exampleZh: 電影的情節太複雜了，我看不懂。

exampleEn: Undaunted by the failure, he tried again with more determination.
exampleZh: 他沒有被失敗嚇倒，而是以此更大的決心再次嘗試。

exampleEn: It was a gutsy move to quit his job and start business.
exampleZh: 辭掉工作創業是一個勇敢的舉動。

exampleEn: Sleep deprivation can lead to serious health problems over time.
exampleZh: 隨著時間的推移，睡眠不足會導致嚴重的健康問題。

exampleEn: The meeting turned into a farce with everyone shouting loudly.
exampleZh: 會議變成了一場鬧劇，每個人都大喊大叫。

exampleEn: The actor portrayed the villain with chilling realism and skill.
exampleZh: 演員以令人不寒而慄的真實感和技巧飾演了反派。

exampleEn: Her portrayal of the queen was praised by critics everywhere.
exampleZh: 她對女王的描繪受到了各地評論家的讚揚。

exampleEn: The solution to the problem remained elusive despite our efforts.
exampleZh: 儘管我們做出了努力，但問題的解決方案仍然難以捉摸。

exampleEn: The thief managed to elude the police by hiding in alley.
exampleZh: 小偷躲在小巷裡，設法躲過了警察。

exampleEn: The dentist checked my incisor for any signs of decay.
exampleZh: 牙醫檢查了我的門牙是否有腐爛的跡象。

exampleEn: The surgeon made a small incision in the patient's abdomen.
exampleZh: 外科醫生在病人的腹部切了一個小切口。

exampleEn: The sculptor used a chisel to carve the stone statue.
exampleZh: 雕刻家用鑿子雕刻石像。

exampleEn: He has a chiselled jawline that makes him look very handsome.
exampleZh: 他輪廓分明的下巴讓他看起來很帥。

exampleEn: The dog likes to gnaw on a bone for hours outside.
exampleZh: 狗喜歡在外面啃骨頭幾個小時。

exampleEn: These exercises will help to elongate your muscles and flexibility.
exampleZh: 這些練習將有助於延長你的肌肉和靈活性。

exampleEn: There was a telltale stain of chocolate on his shirt.
exampleZh: 他的襯衫上有巧克力污漬，說明了一切。

exampleEn: The dentist filled the cavity.
exampleZh: 牙醫填補了蛀牙。

exampleEn: We heard the rustle of leaves as an animal moved nearby.
exampleZh: 當動物在附近移動時，我們聽到了樹葉的沙沙聲。

exampleEn: He tried to glean information from the few documents available.
exampleZh: 他試圖從僅有的幾份文件中收集資訊。

exampleEn: She found her niche in the company working as a designer.
exampleZh: 她在公司找到了設計師的職位。

exampleEn: The gymnast performed a perfect somersault on the floor mat.
exampleZh: 體操運動員在地墊上表演了一個完美的翻筋斗。

exampleEn: The fast ride on the rollercoaster exhilarated the excited children.
exampleZh: 過山車的快速行駛讓興奮的孩子們興高采烈。

exampleEn: Skiing down the mountain was an exhilarating experience for him.
exampleZh: 滑雪下山對他來說是一次令人興奮的經歷。

exampleEn: He felt a sense of exhilaration as he reached the summit.
exampleZh: 當他到達頂峰時，他感到一種興奮感。

exampleEn: The role requires a lot of physicality and strength to perform.
exampleZh: 這個角色需要大量的體力和力量來表演。

exampleEn: He used a machete to hack through the dense jungle growth.
exampleZh: 他用大砍刀砍穿茂密的叢林。

exampleEn: His lust for power drove him to make many bad decisions.
exampleZh: 他對權力的渴望促使他做出了許多錯誤的決定。

exampleEn: It was unsettling to hear strange noises in the empty house.
exampleZh: 在空蕩蕩的房子裡聽到奇怪的聲音令人不安。

exampleEn: The bad news seemed to unsettle him, and he looked worried.
exampleZh: 壞消息似乎讓他感到不安，他看起來很擔心。

exampleEn: They live in a quiet suburban neighborhood with good schools.
exampleZh: 他們住在一個安靜的郊區，那裡有很好的學校。

exampleEn: The novel explores the hidden secrets of life in suburbia.
exampleZh: 這部小說探索了郊區生活的隱藏秘密。

exampleEn: The famous dramatist wrote many plays that are still performed.
exampleZh: 這位著名的劇作家寫了許多至今仍在上演的戲劇。

exampleEn: The author's characterization of the villain was complex and interesting.
exampleZh: 作者對反派的刻畫複雜而有趣。

exampleEn: She has a quirky sense of humor that makes everyone laugh.
exampleZh: 她有一種古怪的幽默感，讓每個人都發笑。

exampleEn: The city sprawls out over a large area of land.
exampleZh: 這座城市蔓延在大片土地上。

exampleEn: It took a lot of ingenuity to solve the complex puzzle.
exampleZh: 解開這個複雜的謎題花了很多心思。

exampleEn: The hotel room offers a stunning panorama of the ocean view.
exampleZh: 飯店房間提供令人驚歎的海景全景。

exampleEn: We took a panoramic photo of the mountains from the top.
exampleZh: 我們從山頂拍了一張山脈的全景照片。

exampleEn: The doctor said the tumor is benign and not dangerous.
exampleZh: 醫生說腫瘤是良性的，沒有危險。

exampleEn: He smiled benignly at the children playing in the park.
exampleZh: 他慈祥地看著在公園裡玩耍的孩子們。

exampleEn: The population of the city has grown explosively in recent years.
exampleZh: 近年來，該市的人口呈現爆炸式增長。

exampleEn: He decided to bequeath his collection of books to the library.
exampleZh: 他決定把他的藏書遺贈給圖書館。

exampleEn: He left a legacy of kindness and generosity to his community.
exampleZh: 他給社區留下了善良和慷慨的遺產。

exampleEn: This fabric is made of synthetic fibers, not natural cotton.
exampleZh: 這種面料由合成纖維製成，而不是天然棉。

exampleEn: The drug is produced synthetically in a laboratory setting.
exampleZh: 該藥物是在實驗室環境中合成生產的。

exampleEn: The team gave a lackluster performance and lost the game.
exampleZh: 球隊表現平平，輸掉了比賽。

exampleEn: The waistband is made of elastic material for a comfortable fit.
exampleZh: 腰帶由彈性材料製成，穿著舒適。

exampleEn: The cruelty of the crime appalled everyone who heard about it.
exampleZh: 罪行的殘忍震驚了每一個聽說這件事的人。

exampleEn: The conditions in the prison were appalling and inhumane.
exampleZh: 監獄裡的條件令人震驚且不人道。

exampleEn: He behaved appallingly at the dinner party, insulting the guests.
exampleZh: 他在晚宴上表現得令人震驚，侮辱了客人。

exampleEn: The cat waited for the right moment to pounce on the mouse.
exampleZh: 貓等待適當的時機撲向老鼠。

exampleEn: Stories abound about the haunted house on the hill.
exampleZh: 關於山上鬼屋的故事很多。

exampleEn: The hot weather seemed to sap my energy completely.
exampleZh: 炎熱的天氣似乎完全耗盡了我的精力。

exampleEn: The job was monotonous, doing the same thing every day.
exampleZh: 這份工作單調乏味，每天做同樣的事情。

exampleEn: The lecturer spoke monotonously, putting the audience to sleep.
exampleZh: 講師講得單調，讓聽眾昏昏欲睡。

exampleEn: He broke the monotony of his daily routine by taking a trip.
exampleZh: 他去旅行打破了日常生活的單調。

exampleEn: When I have a problem, I always turn to my parents for advice.
exampleZh: 當我有問題時，我總是向父母尋求建議。

exampleEn: She came up with an ingenious solution to the difficult problem.
exampleZh: 她為這個難題想出了一個巧妙的解決方案。

exampleEn: A plaque was placed on the wall to honor the building's history.
exampleZh: 牆上掛了一塊牌匾以紀念這座建築的歷史。

exampleEn: The army tried to neutralize the threat before it escalated further.
exampleZh: 軍隊試圖在威脅進一步升級之前將其消除。

exampleEn: The neutralization of the acid made it safe to handle without gloves.
exampleZh: 酸的中和使其可以安全處理而無需戴手套。

exampleEn: The smell of delicious food made the hungry dog salivate heavily.
exampleZh: 美味食物的氣味讓飢餓的狗流了好多口水。

exampleEn: The cessation of hostilities allowed for peace talks to begin.
exampleZh: 敵對行動的停止使和平談判得以開始。

exampleEn: He felt deep remorse for the pain he had caused his family.
exampleZh: 他對給家人造成的痛苦感到深深的悔恨。

exampleEn: The remorseless killer showed no emotion during the trial.
exampleZh: 無情的殺手在審判期間沒有表現出任何情緒。

exampleEn: She apologized remorsefully for her rude behavior at the party.
exampleZh: 她為自己在聚會上的粗魯行為表示歉意。

exampleEn: The sun beat down remorselessly on the desert wanderers all day.
exampleZh: 太陽整天無情地照在沙漠流浪者身上。

exampleEn: His behavior was inexcusable, and he was punished severely.
exampleZh: 他的行為是不可原諒的，他受到了嚴厲的懲罰。

exampleEn: The train was inexcusably late, causing many people to miss work.
exampleZh: 火車晚點得不可原諒，導致許多人誤工。

exampleEn: The elderly man walked unassisted for the first time after surgery.
exampleZh: 老人手術後第一次在無人攙扶的情況下行走。

exampleEn: The scary music served to heighten the tension in the movie scene.
exampleZh: 恐怖的音樂加劇了電影場景中的緊張氣氛。

exampleEn: The light fixture in the hallway needs a new light bulb.
exampleZh: 走廊裡的燈具需要換個新燈泡。

exampleEn: We buy rice in bulk.
exampleZh: 我們大量購買米。

exampleEn: The package is too bulky.
exampleZh: 包裹太笨重了。

exampleEn: He is lifting heavy weights to bulk up for the football season.
exampleZh: 他正在舉重，為足球賽季做準備。

exampleEn: The library plans to digitalize all its old books and manuscripts.
exampleZh: 圖書館計畫將其所有舊書和手稿數字化。

exampleEn: The digitalization of medical records has improved efficiency in hospitals.
exampleZh: 醫療記錄的數字化提高了醫院的效率。

exampleEn: Most stores add a 50% mark-up to the cost of their products.
exampleZh: 大多數商店在產品成本上加價 50%。

exampleEn: These colors are complementary.
exampleZh: 這些顏色互補。

exampleEn: The breakfast is complimentary.
exampleZh: 早餐是免費的。

exampleEn: Rice is a staple food for more than half of the world's population.
exampleZh: 大米是世界上超過一半人口的主食。

exampleEn: The merchant displayed his wares on a table at the market.
exampleZh: 商人在市場的桌子上展示他的商品。

exampleEn: The success of the project is a testament to their hard work.
exampleZh: 該項目的成功證明了他們的努力工作。

exampleEn: The steak was juicy and succulent, cooked to perfection.
exampleZh: 牛排多汁鮮美，烹飪得完美。

exampleEn: The fruit tasted succulently sweet and refreshing on a hot day.
exampleZh: 在炎熱的日子裡，這水果嘗起來甜美多汁，令人清爽。

exampleEn: The lake was tranquil and calm in the early morning light.
exampleZh: 晨光中，湖水平靜安寧。

exampleEn: She went to the countryside to find peace and tranquility.
exampleZh: 她去鄉下尋找平靜和安寧。

exampleEn: His room was spartan, with only a bed and a chair.
exampleZh: 他的房間很簡樸，只有一張床和一把椅子。

exampleEn: Florida is a large peninsula surrounded by water on three sides.
exampleZh: 佛羅里達是一個三面環水的大半島。

exampleEn: They played a game of billiards at the local pub last night.
exampleZh: 昨晚他們在當地酒吧打了一場撞球。

exampleEn: She seems to exude confidence whenever she walks into a room.
exampleZh: 每當她走進房間時，她似乎都散發著自信。

exampleEn: The headmistress welcomed the new students to the school assembly.
exampleZh: 女校長在學校集會上歡迎新學生。

exampleEn: He has a serious mien that makes people think he is angry.
exampleZh: 他面容嚴肅，讓人以為他在生氣。

exampleEn: Her timidity prevented her from speaking up in class discussions.
exampleZh: 她的膽怯使她無法在課堂討論中發言。

exampleEn: The detective tried to unravel the mystery of the missing diamond.
exampleZh: 偵探試圖解開鑽石失蹤之謎。

exampleEn: There was a general concurrence among the board members on the issue.
exampleZh: 董事會成員在這個問題上普遍達成一致。

exampleEn: The weather looked unpromising for our planned picnic outdoors.
exampleZh: 天氣看起來不適合我們計畫的戶外野餐。

exampleEn: The river teems with fish during the spawning season in spring.
exampleZh: 春季產卵季節，河裡魚兒成群。

exampleEn: The police found a corpse buried in the woods yesterday.
exampleZh: 警方昨天在樹林裡發現了一具屍體。

exampleEn: He felt constrained by the strict rules of the organization.
exampleZh: 他感到受到組織嚴格規則的約束。

exampleEn: She became indignant when he accused her of lying to him.
exampleZh: 當他指責她撒謊時，她變得很憤慨。

exampleEn: He denied the charges indignantly, claiming he was innocent.
exampleZh: 他憤怒地否認了指控，聲稱他是無辜的。

exampleEn: His eccentricity makes him a unique and interesting character.
exampleZh: 他的古怪使他不失為一個獨特而有趣的人物。

exampleEn: The old steam locomotive is now displayed in the railway museum for visitors.
exampleZh: 這台舊蒸汽機車現在在鐵路博物館展出供遊客參觀。

exampleEn: Walking is a common form of locomotion for humans and animals.
exampleZh: 行走是人類和動物常見的運動方式。

exampleEn: Western culture often places a high value on individualism.
exampleZh: 西方文化通常非常重視個人主義。

exampleEn: She ceased to enthuse about the project after the budget cuts.
exampleZh: 預算削減後，她不再對該項目充滿熱情。

exampleEn: The drunk man became belligerent and started a fight in bar.
exampleZh: 醉漢變得好鬥，在酒吧裡打了起來。

exampleEn: His belligerence caused him to lose many friends over the years.
exampleZh: 多年來，他的好鬥使他失去了許多朋友。

exampleEn: He accepted his bad luck with stoicism and did not complain.
exampleZh: 他堅忍地接受了自己的厄運，沒有抱怨。

exampleEn: The old writer lived as a recluse, rarely leaving his home.
exampleZh: 這位老作家過著隱居的生活，很少離開家。

exampleEn: She leads a reclusive life and avoids contact with the public.
exampleZh: 她過著隱居的生活，避免與公眾接觸。

exampleEn: We drove down a metalled road that led to the farmhouse.
exampleZh: 我們沿著一條通往農舍的碎石路開車。

exampleEn: He made an oblique reference to the scandal without naming names.
exampleZh: 他隱晦地提到了這醜聞，但沒有指名道姓。

exampleEn: He sent a facsimile of the document to the office headquarters.
exampleZh: 他將文件的傳真件發送到了辦公室總部。

exampleEn: The zombie began to shamble towards the survivors slowly.
exampleZh: 殭屍開始緩慢地蹣跚走向倖存者。

exampleEn: We heard the whir of the fan spinning in the quiet room.
exampleZh: 我們聽到安靜的房間裡風扇轉動的嗡嗡聲。

exampleEn: The disease was a blight on the potato crop, destroying it.
exampleZh: 這種疾病對馬鈴薯作物來說是一種枯萎病，摧毀了它。

exampleEn: They have puritanical views on alcohol and forbid drinking it.
exampleZh: 他們對酒精持有清教徒式的看法，禁止飲酒。

exampleEn: The hen is brooding her eggs.
exampleZh: 母雞正在孵蛋。

exampleEn: She gave him a disdainful look for wearing dirty clothes.
exampleZh: 因為他穿著髒衣服，她輕蔑地看了他一眼。

exampleEn: The zoologist studies animal behavior in their natural habitats.
exampleZh: 動物學家研究動物在其自然棲息地中的行為。

exampleEn: She is studying zoology at university because she loves animals.
exampleZh: 她在大學學習動物學，因為她喜歡動物。

exampleEn: The heavy backpack was an encumbrance during the long hike.
exampleZh: 在長途徒步旅行中，沉重的背包是一個累贅。

exampleEn: Don't encumber yourself with too much luggage on the trip.
exampleZh: 旅行時不要帶太多行李累贅自己。

exampleEn: The scientist tested his hypothesis with a series of experiments.
exampleZh: 科學家通過一系列實證檢驗了他的假設。

exampleEn: Researchers hypothesize that the drug may cure the disease.
exampleZh: 研究人員推測該藥物可能治癒這種疾病。

exampleEn: This is a hypothetical situation, not a real one happening now.
exampleZh: 這是一個假設的情況，不是現在發生的真實情況。

exampleEn: The parasitic worm lived inside the host animal's intestines.
exampleZh: 寄生蟲生活在宿主動物的腸道內。

exampleEn: The peacock displayed its beautiful plumage to attract a mate.
exampleZh: 孔雀展示其美麗的羽毛以吸引配偶。

exampleEn: The building is utilitarian in design, focusing on function.
exampleZh: 這座建築的設計是功利主義的，注重功能。

exampleEn: We should utilize all available resources to finish the project.
exampleZh: 我們應該利用所有可用資源來完成項目。

exampleEn: She has a predilection for spicy food and eats it often.
exampleZh: 她偏愛辛辣食物，經常吃。

exampleEn: The salary will be commensurate with your experience and skills.
exampleZh: 薪水將與您的經驗和技能相稱。

exampleEn: As responsibility increases, the salary should increase commensurately.
exampleZh: 隨著責任的增加，工資也應相應增加。

exampleEn: New evidence emerged to vindicate him and prove his innocence.
exampleZh: 出現了新證據來證明他是正確的並證明他是無辜的。

exampleEn: He felt a sense of vindication when his theory was proven right.
exampleZh: 當他的理論被證明是正確的時，他感到一種平反的感覺。

exampleEn: Jesus told a parable to teach his followers a moral lesson.
exampleZh: 耶穌講了一個寓言來教導他的追隨者道德課程。

exampleEn: We visited the historic minster in the center of the old city.
exampleZh: 我們參觀了位於老城中心歷史悠久的大教堂。

exampleEn: He was wracked with guilt over the accident he caused.
exampleZh: 他因自己造成的事故而深受內疚折磨。

exampleEn: It is ironic that the fire station burned down yesterday.
exampleZh: 諷刺的是，消防局昨天燒燬了。

exampleEn: His callous remark about the tragedy shocked everyone present.
exampleZh: 他對這場悲劇的冷酷言論震驚了在場的所有人。

exampleEn: He callously ignored the beggar asking for food on the street.
exampleZh: 他冷酷地無視街上乞討食物的乞丐。

exampleEn: The derelict building was abandoned and falling apart slowly.
exampleZh: 這座廢棄的建築被遺棄了，正在慢慢倒塌。

exampleEn: He criticized the materialism of modern society and its greed.
exampleZh: 他批評現代社會的唯物主義及其貪婪。

exampleEn: She is very materialistic and only cares about brand name goods.
exampleZh: 她很物質，只關心名牌商品。

exampleEn: The lion attacked its prey with great ferocity and speed.
exampleZh: 獅子以極大的兇猛和速度攻擊獵物。

exampleEn: The music played evokingly, bringing back memories of the past.
exampleZh: 音樂喚起回憶，帶回了過去的記憶。

exampleEn: The student gave a recitation of a poem in front of class.
exampleZh: 學生在全班面前朗誦了一首詩。

exampleEn: He has an equable temper and rarely gets upset about things.
exampleZh: 他性情溫和，很少從對事情感到不安。

exampleEn: There are few extant copies of the ancient manuscript left.
exampleZh: 這古代手稿現存的副本很少。

exampleEn: The government denounced the terrorist attack as a cowardly act.
exampleZh: 政府譴責恐怖襲擊是懦弱的行為。

exampleEn: His fierce denunciation of the policy appeared in all papers.
exampleZh: 他對這項政策的強烈譴責出現在所有報紙上。

exampleEn: Her voice echoed in the empty hall as she shouted loudly.
exampleZh: 當她大聲喊叫時，她的聲音在空蕩蕩的大廳裡迴蕩。

exampleEn: The army requisitioned the trucks to transport soldiers and supplies.
exampleZh: 軍隊徵用卡車運輸士兵和物資。

exampleEn: You need evidence to substantiate your claim in the court.
exampleZh: 你需要在法庭上用證據來證實你的主張。

exampleEn: He has an inscrutable face that hides his true feelings clearly.
exampleZh: 他有一張高深莫測的臉，清楚地掩飾了他的真實感受。

exampleEn: Planes fly high in the stratosphere to avoid bad weather.
exampleZh: 飛機在平流層高空飛行以避開惡劣天氣。

exampleEn: Chocolate cake is my favorite indulgence on weekends.
exampleZh: 巧克力蛋糕是我週末最喜歡的放縱。

exampleEn: The grandmother smiled indulgently at her grandchild's bad behavior.
exampleZh: 祖母對孫子的不良行為寬容地微笑了。

exampleEn: The book received laudatory reviews from critics around world.
exampleZh: 這本書受到世界各地評論家的讚揚。

exampleEn: We should laud the efforts of those who help the poor.
exampleZh: 我們應該讚揚那些幫助窮人的人的努力。

exampleEn: She loves the glitz and glamour of Hollywood movie stars.
exampleZh: 她喜歡好萊塢電影明星的浮華和魅力。

exampleEn: They attended a glitzy party in a high-end hotel ballroom.
exampleZh: 他們在一家高檔飯店的宴會廳參加了一個炫目的派對。

exampleEn: The factory will automate production.
exampleZh: 工廠將自動化生產。

exampleEn: Police apprehended the suspect.
exampleZh: 警方逮捕了嫌疑人。

exampleEn: His athleticism allows him to excel in many different sports.
exampleZh: 他的運動能力使他在許多不同的運動中表現出色。

exampleEn: They bought a large acreage to build a farm and house.
exampleZh: 他們買了一大塊地來建農場和房子。

exampleEn: His British accent is just an affectation; he is American.
exampleZh: 他的英國口音只是矯揉造作；他是美國人。

exampleEn: I hope my visit is not an imposition on your time.
exampleZh: 我希望我的來訪不會打擾您的時間。

exampleEn: The contract stipulates that payment must be made within a week.
exampleZh: 合約規定必須在一週內付款。

exampleEn: One stipulation of the deal is that we act immediately.
exampleZh: 交易的一項規定是我們立即採取行動。

exampleEn: The teacher will allot fifteen minutes for the quiz today.
exampleZh: 老師今天將分配十五分鐘進行測驗。

exampleEn: Each person received a small allotment of food during famine.
exampleZh: 饑荒期間，每個人都分到了一小份食物。

exampleEn: The game ended anticlimactically with a scoreless draw.
exampleZh: 比賽以互交白卷的結局平淡收場。

exampleEn: The forfeiture of his property was ordered by the court judge.
exampleZh: 法院法官下令沒收他的財產。

exampleEn: The media blitz helped to promote the new movie release.
exampleZh: 媒體宣傳攻勢有助於推廣新電影的發行。

exampleEn: The forest is a primeval wilderness untouched by modern humans.
exampleZh: 這片森林是現代人類未觸及的原始荒野。

exampleEn: His tenacity helped him achieve his goals despite many failures.
exampleZh: 儘管多次失敗，他的堅韌幫助他實現了目標。

exampleEn: She is a tenacious worker who never gives up on a task.
exampleZh: 她是一個頑強的工人，從不放棄任務。

exampleEn: He held on tenaciously to his beliefs even when criticized.
exampleZh: 即使受到批評，他仍然頑強地堅持自己的信念。

exampleEn: Genomic research helps us understand the genetic basis of life.
exampleZh: 基因組研究幫助我們了解生命的遺傳基礎。

exampleEn: The viruses are genomically similar but cause different diseases.
exampleZh: 這些病毒在基因組上相似，但會導致不同的疾病。

exampleEn: She carried a capacious bag that held all her books easily.
exampleZh: 她背著一個容量大的包，可以輕鬆裝下她所有的書。

exampleEn: The efficient utilization of resources is key to business success.
exampleZh: 資源的有效利用是商業成功的關鍵。

exampleEn: His answer was an unequivocal 'no' without any hesitation.
exampleZh: 他的回答是毫不猶豫的明確的“不”。

exampleEn: She stated unequivocally that she would not resign from job.
exampleZh: 她明確表示不會辭職。

exampleEn: I love the spontaneity of our road trips without plans.
exampleZh: 我喜歡我們沒有計畫的公路旅行的自發性。

exampleEn: He attacked without provocation, surprising everyone in the room.
exampleZh: 他在沒有挑釁的情況下發動攻擊，讓房間裡的每個人都大吃一驚。

exampleEn: The artist specializes in portraiture, painting realistic faces.
exampleZh: 這位藝術家擅長肖像畫，畫逼真的臉。

exampleEn: Magellan was the first to attempt to circumnavigate the globe.
exampleZh: 麥哲倫是第一個嘗試環球航行的人。

exampleEn: The circumnavigation of the earth takes a long time by boat.
exampleZh: 乘船環遊地球需要很長時間。

exampleEn: I will liaise with the marketing department to coordinate plans.
exampleZh: 我將與營銷部門聯絡以協調計畫。

exampleEn: We have a contractual obligation to finish the work on time.
exampleZh: 我們有合約義務按時完成工作。

exampleEn: He is contractually bound to stay with the company for a year.
exampleZh: 根據合約，他必須在公司待一年。

exampleEn: They lived in abject poverty, unable to afford basic food.
exampleZh: 他們生活在赤貧之中，買不起基本的食物。

exampleEn: He carried a sheaf of papers under his arm to the meeting.
exampleZh: 他腋下夾著一疊文件去開會。

exampleEn: Clear articulation is important when speaking to a large audience.
exampleZh: 對大量聽眾講話時，清晰的發音很重要。

exampleEn: The politician made spurious claims that were easily disproven.
exampleZh: 這位政治家提出了很容易被駁倒的虛假主張。

exampleEn: He argued spuriously that he had no knowledge of the crime.
exampleZh: 他虛偽地辯稱他對這起犯罪一無所知。

exampleEn: Chocolate has a high calorific value and can cause weight gain.
exampleZh: 巧克力的熱量值很高，會導致體重增加。

exampleEn: He likes to fabulate stories about his adventures in space.
exampleZh: 他喜歡編造關於他在太空冒險的故事。

exampleEn: His story was a complete fabulation with no truth in it.
exampleZh: 他的故事完全是捏造的，沒有任何真實性。

exampleEn: The octogenarian still runs a marathon every year at eighty.
exampleZh: 這位八旬老人八十歲時仍然每年跑馬拉松。

exampleEn: The voracity of the fire consumed the entire forest quickly.
exampleZh: 大火的貪婪迅速吞噬了整個森林。

exampleEn: The robber brandished a weapon and demanded money from clerk.
exampleZh: 強盜揮舞著武器向店員要錢。

exampleEn: The statue's face was in a state of calm repose and peace.
exampleZh: 雕像的臉處於平靜安詳的狀態。

exampleEn: He traveled unencumbered by heavy luggage, carrying only a bag.
exampleZh: 他沒有攜帶沉重的行李，只背著一個包旅行。

exampleEn: His constant buffoonery in class annoyed the teacher greatly.
exampleZh: 他在課堂上不斷的滑稽行為讓老師非常惱火。

exampleEn: It was gauche of him to ask how much money she makes.
exampleZh: 他問她賺多少錢是很笨拙的。

exampleEn: She enjoys the quiet domesticity of her life at home.
exampleZh: 她享受在家的安靜家庭生活。

exampleEn: Interest will accrue on your savings account every month.
exampleZh: 利息將每月從您的儲蓄帳戶中產生。

exampleEn: The proliferation of nuclear weapons is a danger to the world.
exampleZh: 核武器的擴散對世界構成威脅。

exampleEn: He used every blandishment he could think of to persuade her.
exampleZh: 他用盡了他能想到的所有甜言蜜語來說服她。

exampleEn: The museum has a large collection of anthropological artifacts.
exampleZh: 博物館收藏了大量人類學文物。

exampleEn: The tribe is anthropologically significant due to its isolation.
exampleZh: 由於與世隔絕，該部落在人類學上具有重要意義。

exampleEn: The wood will carbonize if heated to a very high temperature.
exampleZh: 如果加熱到非常高的溫度，木材會碳化。

exampleEn: He leads a monastic life, dedicated to prayer and study.
exampleZh: 他過著修道院般的生活，致力於祈禱和學習。

exampleEn: She is studying midwifery to help deliver babies safely.
exampleZh: 她正在學習助產學以幫助安全分娩嬰兒。

exampleEn: She wore no jewelry or adornment, preferring a simple look.
exampleZh: 她不戴首飾或裝飾品，喜歡簡單的樣子。

exampleEn: His theory is just conjecture and not based on hard evidence.
exampleZh: 他的理論只是猜測，沒有確鑿的證據。

exampleEn: Gold is a malleable metal that can be shaped easily.
exampleZh: 金是一種延展性金屬，很容易成型。

exampleEn: The malleability of the clay allows children to make shapes.
exampleZh: 粘土的可塑性允許孩子們製作形狀。

exampleEn: Iron ore is mined from the ground and processed into steel.
exampleZh: 鐵礦石從地下開採並加工成鋼。

exampleEn: The fierce gale last night caused significant damage to buildings and trees.
exampleZh: 昨晚的猛烈大風對建築物和樹木造成了重大損害。

exampleEn: They took a leisurely promenade along the beach at sunset.
exampleZh: 日落時分，他們沿著海灘悠閒地散步。

exampleEn: The customer wrote a glowing testimonial about the product.
exampleZh: 顧客寫了一份關於這產品的熱情洋溢的推薦信。

exampleEn: They distill the water to remove impurities and make it safe.
exampleZh: 他們蒸餾水以去除雜質並使其安全。

exampleEn: Whiskey is made through the distillation of fermented grain.
exampleZh: 威士忌是通過蒸餾發酵穀物製成的。

exampleEn: The police received a tip from a confidential informant.
exampleZh: 警方收到了機密線人的線索。

exampleEn: I need to speak to you vis-a-vis the new contract proposal.
exampleZh: 關於新合約提案，我需要和你談談。

exampleEn: He put a transparent overlay on the map to mark the route.
exampleZh: 他在地圖上放了一張透明的覆蓋層來標記路線。

exampleEn: Hearing that old song fills me with nostalgia for my youth.
exampleZh: 聽到那首老歌讓我充滿了對青春的懷念。

exampleEn: She feels nostalgic when looking at old family photos.
exampleZh: 看著舊家庭照片時，她感到懷舊。

exampleEn: He spoke nostalgically about the days when he was a soldier.
exampleZh: 他也懷舊地談到了當兵的日子。

exampleEn: Employees can file a grievance if they are treated unfairly.
exampleZh: 如果員工受到不公平待遇，可以提出申訴。

exampleEn: A sticky residue remained on the glass after removing label.
exampleZh: 撕掉標籤後，玻璃上留下了粘性殘留物。

exampleEn: There was some residual pain in his leg after the surgery.
exampleZh: 手術後他的腿還有一些殘留的疼痛。

exampleEn: Stress causes physiological changes in the body like high pulse.
exampleZh: 壓力會導致身體發生生理變化，如脈搏加快。

exampleEn: Humans are physiologically adapted to live in various climates.
